reviews.text: My husband and I are big fans of the Cheesecake Factory in general! We have been to several locations throughout the US. This is was very disappointing! We went pretty late on a Friday, about 8:45pm. There wasn&#39;t a wait, which was nice! Our waiter took forever to take our drink order, which was just water. Then took almost 10 minutes to bring out the bread. I ordered the chicken Marsala and subbed Mac and cheese (additional charge) for the asparagus and my husband ordered the enchiladas. The food took a very long time to get to the table-nearly 30 minutes, and our waiter never came back during that time to check our water or get us more bread. By the time our food arrived, we had no water. They brought out my entree, but forgot the Mac and cheese. They said it would be right out. 10 minutes pass and our waiter finally shows up and I tell him my Mac and cheese never came. He leaves and more than 5 minutes later, he cane back with my Mac and cheese. My husband and I had finished our meals by then. I was pretty disappointed! So we ask for the check. I thought for sure, they would take the charge for the Mac and cheese off the bill. Nope. They charged me for it. I wasn&#39;t expecting a free meal, but I did fully expect them to take off the Mac and cheese. I was not impressed with the service we received at this Cheesecake Factory. This was the first time I have ever been to a Cheesecake Factory and left without ordering cheesecake. Our main entrees were good, but the service really left a bad taste in my mouth. I do not recommend eating here.

This review is going to reflect my overall experience with eating at Cheesecake Factory Restaurants in Five States. <br><br>I always told my daughter when I die sprinkle my ashes over the Cheesecake Factory. Particularly the one at the Sawgrass Mills Mall. After living in NYC with the many food establishments I am no longer as fond of the high priced National Chain Restaurants. One exception being The Cheesecake Factory! After all it&#39;s all about the CHEESECAKE! <br><br>Remember these are my overall experience. <br>1. Employees are well trained and happy to work here. <br>2. They have the most food selections on their enormous menu than any place except a NYC Diner. <br>3. The portions are enough to take home for a second meal. <br>4. The Cheesecake is just the way I like it. It&#39;s lighter or heavy depending on the flavor you selected. Speaking of flavors, lots to choose between. I&#39;ve got many favorites. <br>5. Price remains comparable no matter what location you visit. I never felt I was overcharged for the meal. <br>6. Service is always timely and food prepared correctly. One exception being newly opened locations that are going through a learning process! Naturally I had that problem in our NYC location. <br>7. The atmosphere is pretty much the same at each location. I find it relaxing with mellow colors. I like the color palette. Bathrooms are always clean. There&#39;s a modern trendy feel to the restaurant. A bar area in case you want to drink and meet friends. <br><br>So there you have it. This visit was Cheesecake Slices to go. We ate in our hotel. Nothing out of the ordinary. Another Cheesecake Factory Visit. Thanks Philadelphia!
Downhill and overpriced. Not consistent in recipe.this happens at every location. Cheesecake goes bad after a day.

I ordered from the Cheesecake Factory today and the Pastas that I ordered were bland, the appetizers were A plus. However, the part that killed me is when there was a well clipped finger nail in my four year old son&#39;s pepperoni flat bread pizza! What are you doing in the kitchen clipping your nails? I&#39;m beyond disgusted and disappointed. During the pandemic, I believe cleanliness would be on everyone&#39;s mind, but I guess not!

DOOR DASH REVIEW:<br><br>i was so disappointed last night when my order arrived. my pasta was so dried up and had barely any sauce on it. my caesar salad was dry as well and could need way more dressing.<br><br> i understand that delivery compromises the quality but for the price i paid, i expected much better. wont be ordering from here anytime soon

I think three stars is an adequate rating for the Cheesecake Factory in Philadelphia. Came with a party of 6 and waited 40 minutes for a table (that&#39;s what we get for going on a Saturday night). <br><br>I ordered an extra dirty martini at the bar in hopes they had their signature one with blue cheese stuffed olives, unfortunately they were all out. I settled for regular olives but my drink was very strong and not at all &#34;extra&#34; dirty. <br><br>The waiter did not greet our table for at least 10 minutes after we were seated. The spinach and artichoke dip we ordered as an appetizer was really good! It was creamy and warm. Unfortunately, there was barely enough chips to get through half of the dish. <br><br>Most of my party went with pasta dishes, including myself. I had the lasagna, which was very..flat. It was mostly noodle and very little stuffing inside. It was vegetarian, without meat, which i thought was a plus. Many lasagnas have meat only options, however where the lasagna lacked meat it lacked everything else. It was noodles piled on noodles. I was left not feeling entirely full. Others in my party had the three cheese pasta, a children&#39;s pizza, and a turkey club. Given a taste of the pasta I wish I had ordered it! The sauce was tasty and the noodles were a tad al denete (which I enjoy, personally). The turkey club my sister had was said to be dry and the pizza was barely touched by the 5 year old because it was &#34;too cold.&#34; <br><br>This would not be my first choice while visiting Philadelphia, but it was okay.

I like the Cheesecake Factory on the simple fact alone is that they have many OPTIONS - the menu is extensive and that will usually meet everyone&#39;s needs.  I am typically not a chain restaurant visitor, but when in a group or family outings - I go with the flow of the group!  In this case, if I am going to indulge - at least I can have a nice view and beautiful decor to enjoy my experience.  This location of the Cheesecake Factor has the views and decor in Spades!  <br><br>I was with a few folks on this visit and we decided to dine on appetizers and drinks and of course the &#34;cheesecake&#34; to finish the night!  We had the Edamame, Dynamite Shrimp, Everything Pizza &amp; Buffalo Wings.  We also ordered the Calamari - but it was overcooked - so we sent it back without any issue from our great waiter &#34;Chris&#34;.  <br><br>Chris was awesome - he was attentive and made our experience enjoyable.  I feel this is a great location and if you are in the area - if nothing else - go get some darn cheese - our choice for the meal was &#34;Red Velvet Cheesecake&#34; and the take home choice was &#34;Key Lime Cheesecake&#34; - Yummy!

I should have looked at the reviews before ordering, maybe then I wouldn&#39;t have been surprised. I ordered the chicken Madeira to take to work, and by the time I was able to sit and eat my dinner I found the chicken completely raw. When I called to inform, they didn&#39;t offer a replacement or anything just said &#34;sorry about that you need to call the app through which you ordered for the refund&#34; and hung up.

Came here a week ago ago with a friend after going to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s elsewhere. It is definitely a chain but their cheesecake is to die for in my opinion.<br><br>Atmosphere: Whatever you want to make it. It is a nice venue, but families come here all the time with little children. You can go casual or go business casual and either way it&#39;ll be a nice dinner! Nice and quiet, can definitely have a great conversation with your food companions here.<br><br>Food: My go to is the avocado egg rolls (they&#39;re vegetarian), the chicken lime penne pasta (they can put the chicken on the side if you&#39;re sharing with a vegetarian!), and a different cheesecake. The avocado egg rolls are ALWAYS a hit. They&#39;re obviously standard and come ready-made, but i love em. They&#39;re flavorful, nice and soft avocado with a crunchy egg roll shell. They come with a lime-based dressing/dip as well. The pasta is very flavorful as well, chicken is usually dry especially if you get it on the side. ...now the best part is obviously the cheesecake lol.<br><br>Cheesecake: per slide will run you about $10, which is super affordable for the giant piece they give you. Definitely share 1 piece with 2-3 people for the sake of your well-being lol. We ordered the nutella chocolate cheesecake which was BOMB!!! It was super rich, chocolatey, had nutella drizzled on top. Sweetness with every bite. Legit couldn&#39;t finish it, had to take it come and eat it later haha. <br><br>Drinks: Just had water! <br><br>Service: Quick and helpful! <br><br>Would 100% come back.<br><br>Pro tip - you can easily order cheesecake to go and not sit down for a meal if that&#39;s what you desire!

Take NY Times&#39; restaurant critic&#39;s review of Guy Fieri&#39;s American Kitchen and Bar in Times Square and substitute &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;  for &#34;American Kitchen and Bar&#34; and your questions are answered.<br>Seriously, my margarita tasted like diabetes and off-brand antifreeze.

Aside from the inconvenient policy of not seating guests until two or more have arrived, the service was tremendous and the food was just as great. I had requested a high-back booth in my online reservation and they honored my request. The server was also very friendly and attentive but also gave us space to enjoy our meal and our company. The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints!

I m annoyed by people putting a review and not describing the context of their review or what they are taking in account for their notation...<br><br>When I saw 3 stars for cheesecake factory, i was chocked!!! As for me the cheesecake served here are among the best I ve ever had, and not only the estetism but the taste as well is great... <br>So after reading the reviews, I ve seen that 99% of bad review doesnt even talk about cheesecakes... lol...<br>And the 5 6 times I ve been was only for cheesecakes^^ so again we are not talking about the same things guys... but you are doing bad overall publicity for a great place for cheesecakes.... so please try at least once to be more objective^^ and say it un your review (I be been there for the restaurant I didnt try cheesecake, I was deceived by the overall menu...) <br><br>And if you want great pasta go to an italian place or I can even give you the recipe to do homemade pasta and homemade sauce^^<br><br>Anyway great cheesecake here, run for this

The building is absolutely beautiful. It&#39;s just a chain but I think that this one really stands out because of the atmosphere. Unfortunately, all of the food is 1,000 calories a plate+.<br><br>The meals here are typically pretty good. I like their burgers although everything off the skinny menu is ridiculously healthy. I just had a veggie burger. It was alright but it came out cold and the pickles were pretty low quality. The bread is good. Service is always really polite but sometimes a bit slow when it is busy. Of course, the cheesecake is great.<br><br>I love coming here for brunch or for dinner after sleeping my entire day away. Great location. Decent food and service.

Came back for the Jamaican chicken and shrimp. It was served without plantains or onions as requested. The manager made things right and the server accepted responsibility. I can&#39;t say that mistakes are uncommon at restaurants but when you still get friendly service despite complaining it says something about the quality of your staff.

The food was a 3, but the excellent customer service bumped it up to a 4! Shout out to our waiter, who was so incredibly attentive and nice! Go here if you have picky eaters in your party (the menu is the size of a phone book), need a family friendly place, or want to go somewhere a little fancier. Just be sure to come here during off hours, cause this location gets BUSY.  <br><br>The menu is the same as any other Cheesecake Factory, and has a huge range of mostly American classics: pasta, burgers, breakfast foods, salads. The free bread basket was piping hot, and the entrees were solid. <br><br>The decor is definitely more luxe than I&#39;m used too--huge ceilings, mood lighting, and gold details. I noticed quite a few people in dressy clothing, so this could be a fancier occasion.

When I rated the Cheesecake Factory local to my home, I thought rating a chain was silly.  All the food is the same, isnt it?  Well - this experience taught me, in fact, IT IS NOT.  <br><br>I get individual pizzas at my local CF all the time - this one was salty and the cheese wasn&#39;t great.  The tater tot appetizer wasn&#39;t heated thoroughly.   The floors are slipper AF.  I asked to bring home the left overs - the tater tots had two sauces on the side - opened the left over the next day to find they didn&#39;t box the sauces.  Lazy.
The food is overpriced, but the cheesecake is wonderful and the only reason they deserve 4 stars. If you&#39;re ever wonder what cheesecake to try, add the carrot cake cheesecake to your list.

Portion sizes have decreased significantly while prices still remain the same. Paid 17 dollars for a fettuccini alfredo that I was able to finish within a few bites. Food taste good, but wish they weren&#39;t as expensive

This was my 1st time EVER trying the Cheesecake Factory in general. The one in Queens, New York is always packed and has a long wait. My friends told me that the one in Long Island, New York was the same thing. We found this place randomly while walking around looking for a place to eat for dinner. The place here is HUGE and we were seated right away. I&#39;m not sure if people were away for the long July 4th weekend, but I was surprised that the place wasn&#39;t crowded.<br><br>Many of the entree options are 1,500+ calories! I&#39;m not surprised because I have heard on the news before that entrees at Cheesecake Factory have high calorie count. We ordered our entrees from the SkinnyLicious Menu. I opted for the Lemon-Garlic Shrimp and it comes with Angel Hair pasta. It was delicious and the shrimp tasted pretty fresh. The food portions were just right and I wasn&#39;t overly stuffed.<br><br>Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. She was happy to fulfill our requests. Our utensils and my napkin cloth were slightly dirty in the beginning and she got replacements for us. She checked up on us often to see if we needed anything else too.<br><br>We didn&#39;t eat cheesecake here since we were full. Maybe next time we&#39;ll leave some room for dessert.

Go to the king of Prussia location instead. <br><br>Egg roll sampler - they were out of the cheese burger sampler, which they replaced with more avocado egg rolls, which were all poorly made and falling apart when picking it up to eat.<br><br>Truffle honey fried chicken - 2 small pieces of fried chicken, which I barely tasted the truffle., and a huge portion of mashed potatoes<br><br>Got some other dishes but I forget the name.<br><br>Pumpkin cheese cake - tasted more like pumpkin pie, needed more of the cheese part<br><br>Mango key like cheese cake - good but wish it didn&#39;t have the coconut flakes at the bottom.<br><br>Would I go back here again? Nope

The service was great, the food was alrighty. Theres only one concern, the cheesecake section of the menu was very hard to order from because everything sounds so delicious!! The cinnabon cinnamon swirl cheesecake was DELISH!!
Yesterday was my Birthday and Madison the server was amazing, friendly and had a great customer services skill. My wife and I had a great time!!!

As ya&#39;ll know, I had a bad chicken casear salad from here last week, which I have to say in retrospect was an isolated incident because I went yesterday for Happy Hour and the food and drinks were AMAZING as usual! I normally only get cheesecake while i;m here but the adventurous side of me said &#34;bruh, lets get some carrotcake&#34;. <br>And lemme tell ya...the Carrotcake was arguably the best I&#39;ve had. I&#39;ve had some good carrotcake in my short life, but the cheescake factory carrot cake was HUGE and very moist! Well worth the $8 value! <br><br>The Nachos are really...really..really good, too. It&#39;s usually all I can handle unless i&#39;m sharing some with my greedy friends, i mean hungry friends. I&#39;m actually going to attempt to try the chicken casear salad again because I&#39;m confident it was a one-time thang. <br><br>Thangs happen, yanno??

My friends and I got a quick bite here and it was great. We got there around lunchtime so it wasn&#39;t much of a crowd, for a Saturday! We were seated pretty quickly and serviced the same. <br>  I normally get the appetizers because they&#39;re a good portion to eat alone or share. I got the Buffalo Blasts and Avocado  Egg rolls! The egg rolls were great and about 7 came with the order. My friends ordered the salmon with rice and it looked amazing as well. <br>  Overall the experience was a good one! It was my first time there and I will be returning. I enjoyed myself here!

Horrible experience. My filet Mignon was served well done eVen though I order medium. Mashed potatoes were so dry it seemed like they were  cooked a week ago and just reheated in a microwave. Will never go back
Sorry, I am really not a big fan of TCF, <br>The steak is literally horrible taste. It&#39;s really just a little bit better than fast food. Lol.

This visit was a bust which makes me sad as we visited with out of town guests.<br>We ordered apps which were good (nachos and artichoke and crab dip). <br>Hubby had a kale salad<br>We barely started and our food came out. <br><br>Hubby was only able to finish half his salad which he held above the table since there were too many large plates (there were 5 of us).<br><br>I ordered the combination ($22 approx) which had my favorite chicken merdiera with a salmon.  The chicken was so small that it was disappointing.  The salmon was drowned in a green chopped parsley (type) that I could not even tell it was salmon.  See my pic<br><br>One plate didn&#39;t come out for about 10 min later so we all waited and ate our food cold.  I mean if you&#39;re going To bring the food out early bring it out together.<br>Everyone&#39;s else said the food was good <br><br>Waitress was eh. I think I was more disappointed that she didn&#39;t say anything when my husband was eating in the air w his bowl <br><br>The others had dessert but I was so turned off by my meal that I didn&#39;t bother. <br><br>$200 later and I was disappointed <br><br>Wish I spent a bit more and went to Delfriscos. <br><br>Yes I&#39;ll try again but I know to avoid the combo and wait to order my meal    I guess w most chains u get a hit or miss you waitress and you have to know the tips when ordering<br><br>I should add the last few times we visited everything is great... this visit was just so disappointing.

Our mistake was sitting down for cheesecake when we should have just gotten takeout. The service was slow (even for just a slice of cheesecake) and the cheesecake was mediocre. I thought the sour cream on top could have been slightly sweeter and the graham cracker crust could have been crisper. <br><br>It&#39;s true that this is historically a family restaurant and has a special grandiose feeling to it, but my Chicken Bellagio days are over. I saw another reviewer below mention that the menu doesn&#39;t have prices for cocktails, which is another area for improvement that I noticed as well.

A group of us met up for dinner, as a friend was visiting from out of town. We all ordered drinks and were unsure of how much they cost as the menu had no price; they were all about $13 which shocked us a little, so please take notice! Also, when we were flipping through the menu, it appears that the Cheesecake Factor recently added &#34;sodium warnings&#34; to items on the menu that had a significant amount of sodium. However, it appears that ... almost every item barring the Skinnilicious menu had warning. But! Every items that we ordered that did not have sodium warnings were still significantly salty! I had the fish tacos and only thought that they were bearable after squeezing lime on them. Even our other friends noticed the amount of salt in their dishes. I know one doesn&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory for a necessarily ... healthy meal, but it was alarming how many of the dishes had sodium warnings and the fact that even dishes not labeled this way were salty.

This rating is for amazing whole wheat baguette that you can buy at the restaurant to take home. I got it warm so it&#39;s very crunchy on the outside but soft and warm inside. $3.50 per baguette plus tax.

I&#39;d describe my dining experience at this Cheesecake Factory branch as a &#34;dining roulette&#34;. For a company that is known for its consistency, this apple fell several feet away from the tree. I&#39;ve been to this restaurant ever since it opened its doors in 2015. Sometimes you get great service and the food turns out spectacularly. Sometimes service is unexpectedly slow and the portion size varies. At one point, this place was dirty too with food residue from previous diners stuck on &#34;clean&#34; utensils and bits of food all over the tables/seats/floors. Today I came here with my date for a late dinner around 8pm, and the restaurant was probably at half its capacity, but service was on the slow side. I had the miso salmon, and compared with the miso salmon I had here over a year ago, it lacked flavor. This time, the salmon was slightly overdone, and the miso taste hardly came through. My date was happy with the salad, so that was a plus. The cakes have so far been the only consistent thing about this place. Thank God they haven&#39;t messed up with the cakes yet, otherwise Cheesecake shouldn&#39;t be in its name. I still find myself coming back to this place because I think they are showing some improvement in certain ways (I.e. the place isn&#39;t as dirty as it was a few years ago). That goes to show you that the people you hire can make or break your business.

At our last visit, my friend&#39;s food came back looking like a plate of vomit (too much cheese and sauce, which overpowered the little amount of pasta on the plate) when she reordered the same dish since the first one was not made right -- parsley stems instead of leaves. We decided to try this location again. During that visit, i have experienced the same issue when i ordered the Lasagne Verde, which did not looked or tasted appetizing... it looked like someone threw all the ingredients together on the plate in a rush; TBH, it looked like another bowl of puke. I had to order another dish since pasta dishes may not be their expertise. While paying for our checks, I noticed a roach walking to the corner of our table. That is DISGUSTING. The service wasnt great either, and needed a lot of improvement.

FYI: Their portion sizes are HUGE and the calorie count definitely matches what you get so you might be eating a full days worth of calories in a single meal. <br><br>The fiancé and I were in center city on a date night sorta type thing and came here before checking out some DIY wedding supplies at the AC Moore nearby. Let&#39;s just say....it&#39;s been a while.<br><br>WHAT I GOT: Grilled fish tacos<br><br>PROS: First of all, I gotta give it up to our waiter. He was legit the sweetest person ever with the way he talked to us and served us during the meal that it made up for the lack of flavor in our food. And I also appreciate the fact that the Cheesecake Factory lists the calorie count of their food. I mean, for how big their portions are, you can kinda guess how much you&#39;re taking in but it&#39;s also good to have a set number. The food was cooked pretty well: nice moist chicken and flaky fish. All the ingredients tasted fresh and there were some good flavor combinations in my taco. The ambiance of this place is also pretty cozy and definitely family friendly.<br><br>CONS: Where to start...well for starters, my taco shells were uhhh...limp and cold. And the fish on the inside joined them within minutes of hitting the table. The cilantro rice they serve with it tasted ok but that&#39;s about it. Just ok. They also gave me a little bowl of beans but I took two bites and left it alone. My fiancé&#39;s truffle honey chicken was incredibly bland though. The skin didn&#39;t taste like much, neither did the meat on the inside. Most of the flavor came from the sauce on the plate. His mashed potatoes were peppery af but with the chicken, it wasn&#39;t terrible. I&#39;m not sure if the quality of the food decreased since the last time I had it but it definitely wasn&#39;t really something I&#39;d be like &#34;dying to try&#34;.

I particularly enjoy the fact that I can get breakfast all day. Cheesecake factory has a nice selection of breakfast style meals you can get all the time. I&#39;m a big fan of poached eggs and they always make my.l Breakfast just right. The breakfast tacos and very handy and tasty. Coffee is always good.
Not the best chicken salad sandwich, very salty wings. Pretty horrible the more I think about it.

Starving, we stopped at the Cheescake Factory for lunch.  The Cheescake Factory isn&#39;t anything special--typical North American kind of dishes, such as pastas, burgers, etc, the type of food that hits the spot when you&#39;re hungry.<br><br>There were plenty of tasty options, but looking through the menu, I was horrified.  I knew the Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t the best place to go if you&#39;re health conscious, but my god, the calorie content was absolutely horrific; most of their dishes were between 1500 to 2000 calories each, an entire day&#39;s worth of calories.  Ugh.  Thank goodness they had a &#34;skinny&#34; menu which offered lower calorie dishes, around 600 calories each.<br><br>Off the skinny menu, I ordered the enchiladas (I just couldn&#39;t order from the regular menu, knowing that I would be consuming 1800 calories in one sitting).  I still don&#39;t quite believe that they were &#34;only&#34; 590 calories, as they were a full portion and extremely filling.<br><br>Overall I am rating The Cheescake Factory only two stars because the food is just average, the calorie content horrifying, and the waiter was a bit condescending.<br><br>[Yelp collections: East Coast 2016]

Do not go for a late night bite- servers DO NOT CARE and the chefs are mentally checked out. Also, our server was acting as if he was under the influence of a stimulant. The food was NOT EDIBLE, we asked for our nachos to be re-done three times and then finally gave up. Never had a problem at another Cheesecake Factory and I would typically recommend but this experience has made me not want to return to any Cheesecake Factory.

Not happy with the portion size. Ordered the Steak Diane, Herb Crusted Salmon combo. Ordered medium rare but they burnt the stake. Also stake was size of chicken nugget. It was a joke! Also overall, terrible service by the staff and waiter. Below average food. Expensive food. Been coming to Cheesecake Factory for almost 15 years not. Mostly with group of friends. Never gain! :(

Disappointment is the first thing i must say<br><br>They are very disorganized, <br>Ran out of silverware, 30 mins for water and<br>Unfriendly service <br><br>There are better places to eat while visiting Philly

This restaurant is quite famous for its cheese cake and we had finally got the chance to try it out. Had the original one and red velvet one, respectively. The red velvet one looked much larger than the original one. Both of these two cheese cakes tasted yummy! Perfect dessert!

Take-out only review.<br><br>One of my friends was in from out of town and was craving cheesecake. We walked a couple blocks over, took the elevator upstairs and were greeted by a hangry mob.<br><br>Well, basically. It was midday on a Saturday and this place was bursting at the seams with people waiting for tables. Originally we planned to eat-in until we heard about the crazy wait time. No thanks.<br><br>Fortunately, they do have a to-go counter. While the process of ordering was a bit unorganized and the staff unfriendly, we were able to snag our cheesecake slices and leave within about 10 minutes.<br><br>I ordered the chocolate chip cookie dough, and it was pretty darn good. I don&#39;t want to consider the calorie count on that thing...but if you&#39;re in the mood for an extra sweet snack, you could very well visit this accessible spot.<br><br>Of course, there&#39;s also the option of stopping in one of the local haunts, where you&#39;re likely to find stellar fare at better prices. But that&#39;s just the anti-chain snob in me speaking!

We had a great time at the CCFactory. Traveling from out of town our group was looking for something familiar but able to handle different palates/dietary restrictions.<br><br>Service was great and the food was better than ever. I was shocked that we were able to get a table so quickly but the food would have been worth the typical 45-60 minute wait (bonus was we didn&#39;t have to wait)

A chain restaraunt favorite. This location is very convenient for those visiting the city. However, it&#39;s gets VERY busy, and without the ability to make a reservation, you could be waiting 30-60 min for a table. When you do get to sit down for your meal, the rest is magic. Avocado Egg Rolls are a must order. Tried the Upside Down Pineapple cheesecake, amazing. Stop by, and request the outside terrace room area for a great view of the city.

I get great solid food everything I&#39;m here. It&#39;s not a diner and not fine dining but right smack in the middle.<br>The servings are enough for a ravenous appetite plus lunch for the next day. Service is a lil slow, but it&#39;s a<br>Packed place always, and theropod comes out so perfect. <br>My go to dish is bang bang chicken but today I chose chicken and fries (pic posted) <br><br>From the servers to the hostess to the managers, everyone is so friendly. <br>The cheesecake selection is EXTENSIVE but don&#39;t leave without getting one to go- I get the caramel pecan.<br><br>Nathan is the best server!!

Started off on a good note, was seated right away. Wasn&#39;t too crowded for a Sunday. The waitress was nice but not attentive. Waited for over half an hour for our food (which we know wasn&#39;t her fault) but haven&#39;t checked on us if we needed a glass of water or anything else. We did noticed she was really attentive to the table behind us. After we got all our food, we noticed that the food was warm, after waiting for so long. But to this point we were really hungry so we didn&#39;t care. Towards the end my friend ordered a mojito, which was really disappointing. It tasted like lemon water, mint leaves and no taste of the alcohol. <br>The food wasn&#39;t bad, just wished the service was better.

Okay, so we went to Philly for the weekend with the intention of a cultural immersion but were starving when we got there mid-morning and thought we&#39;d just go to the nearby Cheesecake Factory for a quick, small (lol yeah right) bite for fuel for our exploration. We were greeted warmly and staff were clean and well presented (everything was clean) and we were seated by the window in a booth without having to ask. <br><br>We ordered the avocado toast to share and not only was it massively generous (like at least 2 avos on that thing), but was fresh and beautifully prepared. We couldn&#39;t have found a more generous helping for close to this price and it really was delicious. My cold vanilla latte was super sweet and divine too. We contemplated going back there for dinner...and we probably should have :(

Whenever I think of the Cheesecake Factory, Vince Young always comes to mind. As his dumpster fire of an NFL career was coming to an end circa 2012, reports began to surface that the former Eagles QB and third overall pick of the 2006 NFL draft was known to spend upwards of $5,000 per week at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I know NFL players enjoy the lavish lifestyle, but come on, $5,000 per week at the CHEESECAKE FACTORY? You&#39;re a millionaire. Treat yourself. That&#39;s like if I went out tonight and spent $200 at Taco Bell (I&#39;ve come close). <br><br>Sources now say Vince Young is now working at an undisclosed Cheesecake Factory location as a short order line cook. Get &#39;em, Vince!<br><br>This was my first visit to a Cheesecake Factory. Not sure how I was able to avoid them for this long. You know, there&#39;s a lot to like about this place. The dining room is pretty darn impressive. Lots of head room. <br><br>Pressed for time, my buddies and I opted to sit at the bar rather than wait for a table. Service was friendly, though not the most attentive. As a fairly outgoing group, we were able to get the attention of the bartenders. But I noticed a lot of quiet couples around us being completely neglected. This was actually making ME feel a little awkward, so I made it a point to tell the bartender not to focus solely on my group and to help the other people standing around. Not sure why this was necessary ... you&#39;d think they would do this on their own.<br><br>Food portions are HUGE! Has anyone else ever ordered the chicken fingers here? You seriously get like two pounds of chicken and another half pound of mashed potatoes. Seriously. It&#39;s obscene. In a good way, of course.<br><br>Would I come back? Sure. I love riding escalators to the main dining room. I don&#39;t get to do that much here in Reading. Weeeeee!

In general, Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to eat. However, the quality of this particular branch leaves much to be desired. A group of my residents and I decided last minute to grab dinner to celebrate the near completion of the semester. Some ordered cheesecake while others ordered appetizers while others ordered large dishes. <br><br>The cheesecake itself was solid as expected and the waitress guided us through the menu, which helped us decided which slices to get. However, while the cheesecake was good, the entrees and appetizers were disappointing. I got the steak and shrimp combo, which is a classic. However, my steak tasted watery and had a dull metallic taste instead of the rich meaty taste that I&#39;m accustomed to. The artichoke dip was also missing the cheesiness of the usual dip. If the food was on par with the cheesecake, perhaps the dining experience would have been better.

We love the Cheesecake Factory in general and have been to multiple locations. This one is filthy dirty. We were sat at a booth that had crumbs all over it, crumbs and hairs on the table, and even hair on our plates. This filth was consistent for the empty tables next to us as well or else we would&#39;ve just asked to be moved. Needless to say, we just walked out. Disappointed as the restaurant was not busy at all so it seems like there could be time to at least wipe tables/booths down between guests.
Great staff awesome food great venue and lightning  fit for all type of functions also kids friendly. Love my first experience. Thanks

I came during a peak time on a Saturday evening to dine alone while on a business trip. I was seated within about 15 minutes of arriving. After receiving my appetizer, my order was put in but I did not receive my entree until an hour and 10 minutes later. My frustration is when I&#39;m sitting next to other tables who arrived and placed their orders after me but received their dishes before me, there&#39;s a failure in service somewhere. My entree was the truffle honey chicken which was okay. The potatoes seemed darker in color as if they sat in the steam table too long and were way too salty to consume.

This isn&#39;t my first time attending the Cheesecake Factory however this experience was one of the best. I&#39;ve had some not so happy experiences here before. Our waitress was quick and attentive. Very polite. I didn&#39;t get a drink but she made sure my water was refilled. Our wings were great and hot as if they just were made which was awesome and the Louisiana Pasta that you see in the photos was delicious! Hopefully I can continue to have experiences like this when I return.

Last night I made reservations for my daughter&#39;s birthday and it was only her and I. The hostess down to the waiters were very polite and welcoming. The food was very good as well as my drinks. My daughter had a free complementary sundae along with them singing to her and she was very excited. I will be going again and I would recommend to others as well. Prices are reasonable too. Establishment is for date nights, family and friends to have a great time the classy way.

My entire dinner party and I received food poisoning from this location on 2/12/2020. Please review how your workers handle the food. If your food is making customers sick even with the standardized safety built into running a chain restaurant, something is deeply amiss. You are putting your customers health at risk

This Cheesecake Factory is two stories. Unexpected 30 minute wait on a Sunday night for a table for four. Please turn the dimmer up so there&#39;s some lighting. I like ambiance but there&#39;s a problem when you can barely see the food in front of you. Table and silverware was unkempt. For some reason, there were still cloth napkins from the previous party before us on the ground.<br><br>Server was solid. Seemed like they were understaffed this night because he did not appear until we were 10 minutes into looking at the menu. Hostess did not set up smaller plates to share. <br><br>Food portions were huge and everything came out hot and delicious. 6 beers on tap and over 280 menu items.

My first time experience at Cheesecake Factory will always be unforgettable. I had a long stressful day at work so I went to the location on 15th and walnut to sit at the bar for a quick meal. The fried calamari was exceptionally good . I also ordered the bbq ranch chicken salad which was also delicious. What stood out to me the most was the bartender Savannah. She was not only polite yet hospitable .. she never let any need of mine go unnoticed. I&#39;ll be back to see her specifically, but in hopes that the full staff is on the same page as her. Thank you savannah for making your guests feel as family. You have made my experience unforgettable and I&#39;ll be looking for you every time I step foot in.

This is probably one of my favorite big chain restaurants, and the Philly location did not let me down. It has a great spot with views of the city which makes it a step above the average Cheesecake Factory at the mall.<br><br>Overall the food is great. The menu can be overwhelming for some since it literally is a 20 page book, but it is filled with a great variety. There is literally something for everyone. There were plenty of vegetarians options, and portions are huge! Don&#39;t forget to save room for cheesecake though. Having tried at least 10 different cheesecakes they have, I have never been disappointed.<br><br>Strangely they seated our party of 5 on a table for 4 and then seated a party of 2 in a large booth for 5/6 people. Maybe they are still working out things since they are still relatively new, but this was really inconvenient. Also, service can be slow since the waiters have lots of tables and literally have to run around to keep up. <br><br>Overall, the food was great, and there is so much more to try so I will be going back.

This location opened on Tuesday... As in they haven&#39;t even been opened for a week and you can tell!!! The wait staff is in a frenzy, everything is slow as hell to come out of the kitchen and bar. But in all fairness, I&#39;m used to dining at the Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki (which is the second busiest location behind Vegas) and they have everything down to a science. <br><br>The reason why I didn&#39;t rate Cheesecake Factory Philly 4 stars is because there is a learning curve that&#39;s happening right now and the presentation of the food was completely impressive. Like I said, I go to Cheesecake Factory often and I&#39;m very familiar with the presentation, but now I know what it&#39;s supposed to look like! <br><br>This is the absolute best place to go in a group! There is something for everyone!!!

Let&#39;s be clear, I only gave 3 stars mainly for ambiance. I love the setup of this Cheesecake. My first time here, me and a group of friends dined for a birthday. We sat in the grand room upstairs and felt like celebs lol. It was so clean and pretty. Our server was nice and accommodating too. She wasn&#39;t intimidated by our large party. She had glasses and braids. I ordered the calamari and a glass of Proseco. My calamari was fried really bad and had chicken on the plate; I assume they fry chicken in the same fryer. Which is ok, but I&#39;m a vegetarian. I unknowingly bit into it, disturbed. I told our server though, and she had no problem taking it back. I didn&#39;t get anything else. <br><br>My second time here I ordered the fettuccine alfredo and had the same server. Sweet, still. This meal was way better though! No complaints for this one. It was so good I couldn&#39;t even finish it all. I&#39;d probably return.

Used to be my favorite restaurant but the service went downhill over the last year. I usually order buffalo blasts but it&#39;s almost feels as if they&#39;re not enjoyable no longer.  Now i leave with a upset stomach. I don&#39;t think the cooking deep fry oil has been changed in months.
Great service , food galore! Love the skinnylicious menu!!  Get the chicken lettuce wrap

I may be biased but Cheesecake Factory is always just ok to me. I ordered the shrimp with angel hair with no tomatoes. The sauce was a little tangy in a strange way, but it wasn&#39;t bad just alright. The shrimp seemed to be just slightly breaded but it could&#39;ve been better if it wasn&#39;t breaded. My boyfriend ordered the grilled chicken and avocado club which he said was good and felt that it was very fresh. I would say the one thing you must ordered when coming here is the fried Mac and cheese which I think is very very good and worth 4 or 5 stars

Whenever I&#39;m in an unfamiliar town the Cheesecake Factory is typically my go- to, especially as a vegan. They have a good amount of vegan options and my favorite is the vegan Cobb salad (with no dressing cause it is flavorful enough without it). Staff has always been friendly no matter what location I&#39;m at. My only complaint is the price, which is a bit much for my liking :(

I came in here just to pick up cheesecake. The young lady at the counter was rude and never even made eye contact with me. It felt as if she didn&#39;t want to be there. If she&#39;s not happy with her job she should find another one. I went in on 02/03/17 around 10:00pm. I hope management reads this and fires her. The gentlemen who made the cake was nicer and was doing his job to the best of his ability.<br><br>I&#39;m spending $8.75 on a slice of cheesecake I would think I would get a thank you and have a good evening. The inside is nice and I&#39;m sure other employees their are nice. The dessert area looked messy and the girl behind the counter just wasn&#39;t professional at all. I won&#39;t be returning to this location. The location in cherry hill is a lot nicer and also a free parking lot and a lot nicer group of employees.

This place was my go to after work. We even began  to plan a company gathering there this summer, however, I started to have bad experiences about a month ago. I ordered takeout twice. Food is scarce, reheated or freezer burned. My first takeout order was through post mates. The food was freezer burned and looked very old. We made two complaints over the phone and another via corporate Facebook. We were denied a refund or gift card three times. Cheesecake repeatedly stated that we should contact Postmates, which is ridiculous given the delivery service has nothing to do with the quality of food.<br>This weekend, we decided to give this location another try, thinking it was just a goof. I went down to the location and picked up the food. I had three orders of fish and chips. I opened the first box of fish/fries and tasted them. They seemed to be okay so I took the food home. When I got home, I quickly realized why the takeout section is so dark. The fish were tiny, some as small as your pinky finger and about an inch thick. We each got one scoop of cold slaw, put very sloppily into the bottoms of small containers. We had a small amount of fries which were put into paper bags instead of inside the container with the fish. This looked like it was done purposefully to appear fuller in quantity. My guests complained of the taste and reheated fries. This Cheesecake Factory does not respect or honor its customers so I didn&#39;t even call to complain. We wasted 60 dollars and went to the supermarket to buy our own fish. Don&#39;t go here. Very disappointed because this location was pretty good until now. See pictures of food in the photo section, if you care to look. The first photo was via Post-mates on 5/5 (old and or freezer burned food). The second picture shows CF&#39;s response when I requested a refund for that meal. The third was from this past weekend 5/19. I only touched the tartar sauce slightly. The fish and cold slaw were received as it appears in the photo. It&#39;s so sloppy and scarce it looks like leftovers.

Visited this location this passed Thursday, I love this restaurant but unfortunately had a bad experience all because of a bad server. Was here for my sisters graduation dinner a party of 6. 2 guests had to leave a bit early so our server split our checks and handed them to everyone. Some people were still eating and never asked for their checks. I asked him to see a dessert menu and he told me he could not add anything to my check once the bill was split. He told me to take a look at the dressert case on my way out. I found this very rude. He could of easily brought me a menu to take a look and start a new check. Why would I want to take my dessert home? I wanted to eat there and enjoy my cheesecake afterwards without being rushed. It is called the Cheesecake Factory after all. You don&#39;t think to ask if I want dessert?!

Just paid $17 for a nothing entree! This is ridiculous! Got the shrimp pasta and there is maybe 1/8 a cup of pasta. This is ridiculous. I called to complain and the lady just put me on hold. <br><br>Update - management contacted me back, so hopefully they do something about this.
Always a pleasure to come and eat there. The service is great, the food is amazing. I always love to come there and eat.

This place is a waste for its prime location. No prices on cocktail or draft beers, cheesecake menu.. ok so should we all be pretentious and pay for things we don&#39;t know the prices of? <br>Therefore I asked how much the PASSIONFRUIT mojito is, she said &#34;I believe it&#39;s around $11&#34;... <br>im sorry... I believe? That could mean a lot of things. I don&#39;t want to order a drink and get a check of a cocktail for $14. If I wanted that I could go to Rumor. <br>After I asked for the cocktail price.. the waitress gave me a disdained look and never came back! Didn&#39;t even look at my friend and I again. Ok so I guess she assumed that we were poor cuz we asked the price of a mojito. After literally 15  minutes of no service, no water (cricket).. we LEFT. So I don&#39;t do this a lot, reviewing without trying the food. But here it is! My first and last Cheesecake Factory visit.

Giving this place a one star due to what I found in my food. My brother order some food to take out for me and as I&#39;m eating what I found was a peace of metal that I was about to cut my month with. What kind of restaurant doesn&#39;t clean it pans and check to make sure theirs nothing left on them. If I had choke or had cut my month or throat they would be hearing a lawsuit from me

Came here last night for a late dinner! After a bad experience at The Cheesecake Factory at a different location, we still had the tastes buds for this food so we ended up at the one in the Philly. Food was way better! We got the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic and tomato basil pasta. Both delicious and came out perfect! This is more of a 3.5/5 stars because our waiter never came to check up on us when our food came out so we couldn&#39;t ask for refills on our drinks, he never gave us our bread, and because the women&#39;s bathrooms were a mess - toilet paper on the floors, no toilet paper in the holders. Regardless, this dinner hit our food cravings!

Came here with 4 other people and we were seated within a few minutes.<br><br>We were given a menu and then asked about drinks, I got the Peach Smoothie and my friends got water with lemon(the waiter was really chill about it; some waiters might get irritated with extra work of lemon). <br><br>We started with appetizers which was nachos, cheese covered with something(sorry forgot) and BBQ chicken. <br><br>The nachos was BIG that 4 of us could not even finish. ONLY get the nachos if you&#39;re super hungry and have a big group of people. The cheese cover was very rich and cheesy. The BBQ chicken was cooked just right and my friend finished that all!<br><br>The meals came and I got the lunch special of sausage and shrimp pasta. The sausage and shrimp was AMAZING and pasta sauce tasted so fresh!!<br><br>The peach drink tasted organic and very fresh but I still prefer their Mango Iced Tea but I&#39;m trying to taste all their drinks.<br><br>My friend got a burger and he asked for cheese on it, in which was not given to us at first but the waiter remembered as she brought it over and went back into the kitchen which shows she has great instinct and memorization, I guess... but the waiter was really good with coming to us regularly and not too much, refilling our bread, and even enjoying some laughs with us.

Horrible service in the bar area couldn&#39;t get our order correct. I think the poor service was intentional. Requested my money back due to the horrible service. The cook and the servers need to be taught how to discuss orders but again the poor service was intentionally done. Please take classes on race and deal with your discrimination policies because it really showed last night.

It was in my bucket list to go to the cheese cake factory and have their best cheese cake. I ended up ordering a spicy chicken chipotle pasta for dinner and then ended my night with their recommended Godiva chocolate cheesecake. The pasta was delicious and comes with a huge plate so if you are ordering for just yourself then you might need a takeaway box at the end. The cheesecake was super tasty, but I think this wasn&#39;t the best they have. I will surely try other cheesecakes first and then comment something on it. Btw our server John was very polite and sweet. He recommended both pasta and cheesecake which I appreciate.

Ever since I was little, Cheesecake was the place to go to bond with family over amazing food. Every person you bring can find something they&#39;ll love on the menu. ALWAYS consistent with their food. ALWAYS amazing ambiance. This location is HUGE for the center city location. I loveeeeeee you Cheesecake Factory.

I went here once while visiting philly and never again. I literally got up to fill my own water because the server went ghost on us for a half an hour. Eat at home or even at McDonald&#39;s. I promise you&#39;ll enjoy it more :)

Came here with my boyfriend last night as we were deciding between iHOP and the CF since we were both really hungry and just wanted filling food. <br><br>The first thing I noticed was that when our waiter brought over our water there were lemon slices floating in it. I&#39;m not a health freak but I always prefer my lemon wedges on the side of the glass because who knows if they even washed them? Anyway it was just a passing thought and I didn&#39;t think anything of it. <br><br>I ordered the pasta carbonara and immediately I knew there was something wrong. The sauce tasted so bland, except where the waitress grated Parmesan cheese over. I added salt and pepper and there was barely any difference. Regardless, I finished about half of it before my boyfriend and I decided to take the rest of our food to go. <br><br>I got home and I felt really sick all of a sudden. I went to bed early and when I got up for work the next morning I had an upset stomach. I called out from work and thank God that I did because a half hour later I threw up all the fluids I drank that morning. I threw up two more times afterwards and had an upset stomach two more times later in the day. <br><br>I didn&#39;t associate this with anything until I called my boyfriend at work and he said it sounded like I had food poisoning. I read up on the symptoms of it and he was right. I was shaking, feeling feverish, and my hands and feet were tingling. I had lost so much fluids that every time I stood up I started seeing black and white and had to hold onto something. <br><br>My boyfriend has been in the industry for more than 20 years, owned restaurants, been a partner, and been a general manager. He said that when sauces are left out too long, they lose their taste, and that was probably why I got so sick. He said he noticed me seasoning my dish with salt and was surprised as places like the Cheesecake Factory have dishes with high calorie counts and are already so flavorful to the point of being unhealthy. <br><br>I called the restaurant and told Anthony the GM what I had experienced and he offered to give me a gift card. I said no thank you and would prefer a partial refund for at least my portion of the meal. He said that it was not possible. I even offered to bring in the food we had taken home for him to inspect but he said it was not necessary. <br><br>Due to his lack of assistance, I called the guest services line in California and they were much more kind even though they still refused to offer a refund, though they did offer to look into the issue. They offered a gift card as well and I was thinking to myself, &#34;are these people serious? They think I want to get food poisoning again for free this time.&#34; I said even if they can&#39;t offer me a refund I don&#39;t need a gift card as I would never return. <br><br>Clearly TCF Is only interested in money and not winning their customers back or making sure their health inspection standards are on par. Thanks for nothing!!!!

So this was my second experience with The Cheesecake Factory in Philadelphia and honestly might be my last. My first time going was wonderful. Food and service was great and well worth the price, but this time was nothing compared to my first visit. My waiter was so rude. I tried to give him a break because he seemed tired and it was 9pm but the times after that was a no go. <br><br>Examples : made me feel rushed to order, very passive aggressive, took my appetizer away even though I wasn&#39;t done with it, asked if the tip was &#34;all of it&#34;. <br><br>And it honestly just wasn&#39;t the waiter/service, the food has noticeably gone down in size since my first visit. The food was very bland. Just the worst dinner ever.

The place is well design in the center city location. But the service from the cook is horrible. I ask for a well cook stuffed burger &#34;burnt&#34;. They brought me a rare cook burger. So i let the waitress know. So she said sorry for the mistake. Long story short, the second time around smh. The burger was bloody like hell. I&#39;m glad that i didnt bite into the mess. But all i left out of that place with is sweet potatoes and a free damn red velvet cheese cake.

This place is so good! They have nice staff! Amazing small plates! I was really impressed about their small plates because it&#39;s not a known tapas place. Who would of known??!! This is not my first visit and definitely won&#39;t be my last..

The Cheesecake Factory never fails to disappoint. It is for sure my favorite chain restaurant. This time I tried the Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cheesecake topped with Nutella that just debuted on July 29th. It was incredible! I hope it&#39;s here to stay. <br><br>In regards to this location in particular, the building and atmosphere is stunning!!!

This was probably the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. The service was terrible, they brought us the wrong dish and then argued with us when we tried to explain why it&#39;s the wrong dish and whah ingredients were missing. The salad had chunks of bad romaine in it which was disappointing. That being said, the food was still good but definitely not up to Cheesecake Factory standards. It&#39;s a shame because the location is ideal and the decor and layout are very pretty.

This is just steps from my apartment so I enjoy ordering food to go and going to pick it up. Because of this, my food is always hot and delicious. The chicken quesadillas are great, shrimp and angel hair is great, the chicken fingers are delicious, and of course the cheesecake is yummy. So much fat though!

So I&#39;m a picky eater. I hate it, and no matter how much I try foods or try to force myself to like whatever, I can&#39;t rearrange my tastebuds. I&#39;ll usually order something simple, sometimes I&#39;ll just munch on bread. The rude comments and judgement, sneers, and just plain hatred I&#39;ve received from waitstaff at place I&#39;ve dined has made me almost afraid to go out to eat. <br>THIS LOCATION IS WONDERFUL. My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday and our waitress was friendly, brought extra extra bread to our table without even a second thought, didn&#39;t judge, didn&#39;t make rude comments at my weird eating habits. If I could&#39;ve flagged down a manager I&#39;d have given her a 10 Star review. Service was fast, everything was delicious, we had a lovely dinner, and I&#39;m a little less self conscious about eating at restaurants. Will be eating here again.

I came here on a Saturday afternoon with a fairly big party of mainly teenage girls. They were done rehearsals and gearing up for a performance in a few hours. Cheesecake Factory with their large menu and portions is a good pick because everyone can find something they like... Since it was lunch time we could order the lunch portions and go easy on the pockets. <br>I&#39;d never been to this location.. So one thing I will say is coming in and seeing the hostess stand on the first floor with no one standing there threw us off a bit, sent one of the girls up on the elevator and she ushered us to come up... As we rode up, we saw the hustle a bustle that is Cheesecake Factory. They didn&#39;t at all seem annoyed or flustered when we told them party of 10... Within about 10 minutes we were seated. We had one waitress that took care of us.. I like that a lot better than having 2 for either side of the table, and she did an awesome job keeping everything straight. We all pretty much knew what we wanted since we needed time for food to digest and settle prior to show time that was one of the requirements, lol know what u want and no dessert. I hated the no dessert rule after all it was Cheesecake Factory, but hey the food was filling. <br><br>I ordered the salmon off of the gluten free menu, swapped the broccoli for asparagus, so glad I made that choice, I must say some of the best asparagus I&#39;ve had in a long time. The meal as a whole was considerably better than any of the cheesecake factory&#39;s I have been to. There is one 5 minutes from me that I usually end up at, but this one put them to shame. I&#39;m definitely a fan, I usually end up here for convenience rather than choice, but this location is awesome. There was a slight mishap where when two of the girls ordered pasta with red sauce they were asked if they wanted tomatoes, so given the choice they said no, but it came out with tomatoes, when they questioned it, our waitress took it back but then came back saying that&#39;s just how it comes.. She apologized, knowing she had asked them, the girls were fine, pushed them to the side and still enjoyed the meal, overall it was a great meal, everyone enjoyed, it wasn&#39;t dragged out or we weren&#39;t rushed, it was a success!

I always have a good meal at any Cheesecake Factory but we were on vacation in philly and decided to stop, this was one of the best experiences we&#39;ve had at a restaurant. I wish I could remember our waitresses name but she was amazing and super nice. If we were ever in the area again we would definitely come back.

Overall, great experience at The Cheesecake Factory . I usually enjoy their seafood and most of their pasta dishes. The one thing that I&#39;ve found disappointing, along with my friends, is their burger. I think the meat just doesn&#39;t taste good. The bread they serve, never disappoints. I love snacking on it while my appetizers and entrees come out. If you visit, do NOT leave without trying one of their cheesecakes! My favorite is the tiramisu cheesecake ! If you love chocolate, their Godiva one is rich in chocolate !

It&#39;s always good here. The food is consistently good. A big menu so there is something for everyone. I&#39;ve been here several times and the staff has always been helpful and had good opinions about the menu items if you&#39;ve narrowed down your choices to two or three and need help making a final decision.

Great place too my grandson and my friend with me for the first time in years and loved it my grandson turned 6 they sang him happy birthday and everything and were wonderful our server was great and our food was out at the table before 20 minutes and tasted great and the cheesecake amazing. I wish I could remember the servers name she was amazing

I can into Cheesecake Factory downtowns Philadelphia location and this is the SECOND day in a row I was not served! I&#39;m highly upset. I wanted to sit at the bar but  whole bar was dirty and there were only 2 costumers sitting at the bar. I asked if the bar be cleaned off and they escorted me to another seat where I didn&#39;t want to sit. Then the server did not give me a menu untill 15mins later I bearly got a chance to ask her for water before she walked away and I still had to wait 20 mins to get water. I was sitting there another 30 mins then finally I left. IM GOING TO MAKE THIS CLEAR it was not that busy especially for diner time the people sitting next to me were finished eating and waiting for a check and also looked very upset.
We would love to go back there again. The food was very tasty especially the avocado roll The waitress was pleasant
As for me this is the best place to go for a cheesecake. And the other food is always great and fresh, however I heard a lot of complains from my friend. But I love the place

My friend, Naomi (also known as BB or Birthday Bitch), invited a group of around 10 friends to the Cheesecake Factory for a celebration of her being born.  I had been to the King of Prussia CF but never to the downtown location.  The CF is always a bit of an odyssey into another world, where people have expendable cash and suburban hairstyles and where decadence is supremely exalted, in both garish displays of décor and overall gluttony.  In this way, the Cheesecake Factory is a quite viscerally American experience.<br><br>While waiting at the bar I chatted with my buddy, Hawkeye, and spent $10 on a bottled Angry Orchard.  Cocktails were in the double digit range, and seeing how I was a poor social worker masquerading as a person who can afford to eat at fancy restaurants, I opted to not get any more alcoholic drinks throughout my stay.<br><br>Eventually we were moved to a large table that could accommodate our group.  Our server was polite and attentive and tolerant of our low class requests, such as bringing me hot sauce to pair with the free bread they serve.  Speaking of the free bread, it was delicious and regrettably I ate quite a lot of it despite having given up gluten recently.<br><br>Communing with the other indigent social workers, Hawkeye and I decided to split some nachos with our friend Brenda.  The calorie content was well over your overall daily allowance so it seemed that splitting it three ways would be wise.  Getting swept up in the gluttony of this establishment, I impulsively decided to also order their &#34;Nashville Hot&#34; chicken nuggets which were only $5.  They claimed to be quite hot, which I considered dubious but figured it was worth a try.<br><br>When the nachos arrived, they were as enormous as we had hoped and had generous portions of good toppings including spicy chicken, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.  I wouldn&#39;t say that there was anything particularly &#34;special&#34; about these nachos, but they were large, filling, and tasty so I was very happy with this decision.  They were also more than enough for three people and frankly I did not need my impulsive chicken nuggets.  Speaking of the chicken nuggets, I found them very underwhelming.  Only one chicken nugget out of ten was sufficiently saucy and the overall heat level was practically imperceptible.<br><br>BB&#39;s new man friend, Landon (who worked hard all night to prove to us that he wasn&#39;t a Blandon) got the fried mac and cheese balls and generously shared with the table in what I can only imagine was a ploy to win good favor in the group.  These were cheese-filled pillows of heaven and you could only hope to be so lucky as to get to experience them for free at some point in your lifetime.  He also got a very mysterious dish which was a pizza made with chicken-parmesan crust and pasta on top.  I didn&#39;t get to taste it but I can only imagine that it was quite indulgent.<br><br>At the conclusion of the meal, a handful of the brave ordered cheesecake.  Thanks to the plentiful free bread I was bloated up like a hot air balloon and had no money or appetite left for dessert but I admired those that were able to go &#34;all the way.&#34;  I have had CF Cheesecake before and it&#39;s incredibly delicious, probably as a result of each slice including over three quarters of your daily calorie content.<br><br>In the end, what could be more wholesomely American than group of ten 20-something-year-olds (okay fine, I&#39;m 30...) caucusing in the soft glow of ornate chandeliers of ostentation, eating a week&#39;s worth of calories in food they will have to buy on credit to afford, surrounded by suburban families ignoring everything but their iphones.  BB seemed happy to usher in a new year of life in this manner and frankly I enjoyed myself and the food very much.

I Love this place! The atmosphere, the drinks, the food,all of it... Well except maybe one small matter. The wait staff. That and that alone is what this place lacks in all of their restaurants. They hire these very young immature kids that just don&#39;t have any class and do not give this great establishment the props it deserves. These kids are not the most intelligent young people this world has to offer. ( Please don&#39;t ask them to do math) but with that said, I still LOVE THIS PLACE!

Wow this was a perfect place for my 17 year old son and I to have a nice dinner and enjoy ourselves. Tiera was our server - she is absolutely amazing!!! The best!!! She has a great personality and was always checking in on us, we loved her! The food was perfect, tasty, yum!!! We were so happy, thanks for a great meal in Phily!

This is a cheesecake factory review for their dessert because imo that&#39;s what sets them apart!! <br><br>Although cheesecake is in the name, I would say the sundaes are a slightly better dessert option on the menu! I have never been disappointed in a cheesecake from here but I have also never been stuffed. If you want to have a large dessert to share, I would suggest the hot fudge or rocky road sundae. It&#39;s large enough for 2-3 people and if you ask for no whipped cream I&#39;m almost positive you get more ice cream haha.

At Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>And I keep asking myself, why I&#39;m here? and why anyone would want to come here. <br><br>If you are planning on going, I&#39;ve got you covered:<br>- Grumpy, unsmiling staff, including the host!<br>- inattentive , slow, and totally uninformed waitress. P.s: she was friendly thou.<br>- No prices on cocktail menu. <br>- Dirty silverware!!!<br>- Mediocre mango key lime cheesecake.<br>- I don&#39;t understand why it was so difficult to split the check. <br><br>One and half Yelps is two generous!

Overall I love the Cheesecake Factory and it many locations but this one is pretty amazing. You get to go up these escalators just to get to the restaurant which is pretty fancy, not to mention the awesome views of the city. Food and service excellent.
We waited at our table for 15-20 minutes and never received any service. After asking several waiters about our waiter we were rudely ignored.

The place is so great. The atmosphere is really nice. I order same food almost every time I am there, and it is always perfect. And cheesecakes, salted caramel cheesecake is absolutely the best. Servers are always friendly and nice. All in all one of the best places to go for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends.
Great lunch out! I had the fried zucchini appetizer and the carbonara with added chicken. They do lunches until 5pm and happy hour from 4pm. Sat at the bar, service was great, very friendly.

This location just recently opened so I think they&#39;re still sorting out everything. I got the chicken pasta carbonara and my friend got the santa fe salad. She asked for her salad dressing to be on the side but they mixed it in. The waitress was really nice about it and got her another one but it took awhile. From the time we sat down to the time we left it was a good 2.5-3 hours. <br><br>Location- 5/5 Excellent decor and location is right in the middle of center city on 15th and Walnut<br>Food- 3/5 Average cheesecake factory food<br>Service- 3/5 They&#39;re super busy and the food took awhile to come out<br><br>If you come here just remember to factor in time....

Service was extremely slow. Food was nothing special - i could easily make them in my own kitchen faster than our 1 hour wait to get our food. Due to the long wait my boyfriend ordered 2 beers and they refused to let him have more than 1 at a time.... Now that is just cruel. Waitress was sweet and professional, but this location seems to be understaffed and unorganized. Will not be coming back until i get a gift card.

Very fancy decor. Food was okay. We got the oreo cheesecake, which was great. I&#39;m not a big fan of cheesecakes, but the oreo was pretty good compared to the others I&#39;ve had. <br><br>Extravagant, dim-lit restaurants (or cheesecakes) are just not for me though. It&#39;d be a good spot for special occasions or dates, but i think it&#39;s rather overrated.

One thing dont expert same what we expert from other chesse cake factory <br>Moo was our surver he is good , food was assume like always we had stuff mushroom .chickrn blast , tax max egg roll but I will tell u secret why I always love chese cake factory is ? Only standered ,I usually go at king of pusria they always have same dress for everyone and how they talk ,how they present everything ,still love this place but could be little bit more ,I will come back again ,thanks to be have this location in city .

Pretty basic. I liked our appetizers: Chicken samosas and shrimp rolls (Vietnamese style). You know, Cheesecake Factory has their standard items. My rating is pretty much for the service here. It was just slow. It appeared our waiter was stretched too thin, there were some times he was overattentive, but for a large portion of the meal (we were there for lunch), he was MIA. There were swaths of time where all of our dishes were on the table without being taken away for room, where we wanted more water, where we waited to order the food, waited for the check. It just was inconsistently timed the whole lunch. It&#39;s a nice location, but I have yet to be wowed at this Cheesecake Factory&#39;s service.

The Cheesecake Factory was AMAZING, but pricey. Not everything was good, but if you order the right things, it&#39;d be a perfect meal.<br>The portions were huge as well. If you&#39;re an average eater, one entree is good enough for two. <br><br>Four of us had 1 appetizer and 3 entrées, 2 cheesecakes and 1 ice cream. The bill came up to 100. Just to let you know. Service was great, though food came a little slow. Still. Food was food. No complaints. <br><br>Orders: <br>Calamari - was salty, though with a nice crisp. Still not worth it<br>Bang Bang chicken and shrimp - distinct Thai flavor with pineapple. Great great dish if you love Thai. <br>Steak Diane - amazing. Very well done. Had a medium rare. Mushrooms were perfect. <br>Some sort of deep fried chicken pasta - very average, even possibly below average. <br>Smores cheesecake - Fantastic, if you love Smores or chocolate.<br>Red velvet - average, nothing outstanding<br>Hot fudge sundae - below average, was meh.

This was probably the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. Got there at 11 am with a party of six. Our party ordered a mix of lunch specials. <br><br>My meal, the Chicken salad sandwich, was almost 100% mayo. Just pure mayo. Not even sure if there was chicken in it. My friend got the Orange chicken lunch special and it came out cold. The texture was extremely mushy, it almost disintegrated in your mouth. A burger at the table tasted and looked like they found it in the dumpster. Buffalo chicken sandwich had no buffalo sauce on it. Fries and nachos were good but not sure how you can screw those up. Some things in our table were almost inedible. <br><br>Service was good and attentive but the restaurant was completely empty so can&#39;t speak to the quality when they are busier. <br><br>To be fair, we didn&#39;t bring these negative comments up to our server or management as we just really wanted to get of out there but this location NEEDS to shape up and immediately.

Walk in and notice it&#39;s a 2 story restaurant and I stand at the hostess stand for 3 min. After waiting I decide to walk up stairs to try and find someone, to no avail. So, I walk back down stairs and wait another 5 min with 2 other parties. Eventually I decide to call the place and with no apology they say come up stairs. I&#39;m greater by a manager being told someone made a mess of the bathroom so the hostess had to clean it up. There is so much wrong with this situation! <br><br>After being sat I waited and waited for service ...<br><br>By far my worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>On a good note once I received service he was very professional and had great service.

Love the cheesecake which is really amazing and the interior of the restaurant looks so fancy. The only thing that I complained about just the service. The food came out way too long which took about 40 minutes. Overall is okay.

In philly for a conference and are at many a cheesecake factory - always good.  Ordered the edamame appetizer and steak diane shrimp scampi combo.  The scampi was cold.  I don&#39;t mean it was only warm.  It was less than room temperature.  Waiter took it to heat it up.  In the microwave...   there&#39;s a reason microwaved shrimp isn&#39;t on the menu it turns rubbery.  And the medium steak becomes well once nuked...  but not to fear, as the waiter went to heat up the plate, the edamame arrived.  Yup 5 minutes after the main was served.  Yup that be backwards.  So I though I&#39;d salvage the mean with a nice ice cream Sunday.  Ordered it and a few minutes later comes back and says they are out.  He nicely rattled off all the deserts they were out of (at 6:15 PM- not 11:00 mind you when you would expect that).  So that&#39;s 0 stars for the food.  Waiter was a nice guy though.

On busy nights, it can be very loud and feel crowded because the tables are close together, along with long wait times. If you&#39;re able to get a seat in the patio, it is unbelievably quiet and like you&#39;re in a whole different restaurant. I do wish reservations were accepted on the weekend. With that said, the food is amazing (especially the mac and cheeseburger), the service is amazing, and my husband and I request the patio and just spend the wait time enjoying each other on our night out, so this is definitely one of my favorite restaurants

I am a sweet-tooth, so I like desserts. And cheesecake factory offers a great deal of it. My first time was a definite &#34;Yehey!&#34;. I like the setting and I remember I enjoyed my food, serving was huge, i like their complimentary wheat bread, plus I have Godiva cheesecake too. I would recommend this place for first time visitors in Philadelphia or in the US. Try it!<br><br>However, I feel i got used to it and later on I feel that there&#39;s really nothing &#39;wow&#39; on the menu if ever you will have lunch or dinner there, save for the cakes of course.

Beautiful place for a lavish dinner. The menu is cheese cake factory, the feeling you get when you come here really accentuates the dining experience.<br><br>The menu has been updated with newer items I have never seen before. My favorite go to of all time is Thai lettuce wrap, you can&#39;t go wrong with a plate of healthy veggies along with some chicken.<br><br>Service is overall friendly and the view when given at certain seating locations is amazing. One of the best places for birthdays or anniversaries.<br><br>Highly recommended

This was my first time here it was four of us I liked that it was not very crowded but it was very dark could not read the menu without my phone flashlight my server was all over the place we got water after our beverages and we waited a whole for him to come back n take my son&#39;s order since they say we serve breakfast all day but they don&#39;t only certain things but the food was good I thought for the price I did not get enough shrimp n I think for the amount of people there our server was just not available when we needed him I will return saw something on the lunch menu I would like to try but drinks are beyond pricey 14.00 for a margarita that was not good

This was our second time at this location the first time was great. This time sucked so bad. The bread cold ask for it to be heated twice came back then burnt but hot.... then the tempura shrimp was disgusting and cold and shriveled up. Never had such a bad experience. Then my salad had cold chicken on it. Awful awful

Cheesecake factory has been around for the longest but we decided to dine in tonight because the waiting line at max brenner was just too crazy . I first had cheesecake factory when it was opened years ago back at home in Boston. I never really liked the food there . 5 stars goes towards their cheesecakes though. So we decided to give cheesecake factory a second chance. <br><br>When we first walked in hostess greeted us but gave us a weird look instead of a smile . Points off there . And then told us there&#39;s about 15 to 20 mins wait and we said okay that&#39;s fine. She didn&#39;t lock us in the computer at first until another  group came in after us and see us just standing there. We then was given a number beeper and told we could go right ahead upstairs . Surprising the wait wasn&#39;t long . So that was good .<br><br>Took us a bit to look over the menu because there was a variety to choose from.
