So our waitress came and took our orders for drinks and apps . We decided to get buffalo Blast and dynamite shrimp for appetizers (as pictured) . The Buffalo blast was good . The dynamite shrimp was okay. It could use a little more flavor . For entrée I decided to go with the chicken marsala and my boyfriend got the meatloaf. When the drink came she only brought my boyfriend drink and told me my drink will be out shortly. I thoughts all the drinks supposed to come out at the same time and not just one and while the other wait for theirs . But okay. The first appetizer came out which was the Buffalo blast half way eating it my drink still hasn&#39;t come yet and I was thirsty after a few bites . My drink didn&#39;t come out until my entrée came out which was probably 20 mins after . Sign of bad service because the couple next to us ordered drinks and all their drinks came out right away by a different waitress . After a few bites of our food we was ready to leave because my boyfriend didn&#39;t like how his food taste and my chicken marsala was sweet and the sauce tasted burnt while I was eating it . I didn&#39;t want to make a big deal out of it so we just asked the waitress to packed the food to go . I should of just stick to my instance and went elsewhere because the food hasn&#39;t meet our expectations . I won&#39;t return to dine in but definitely for the cheesecakes.

Ate here yesterday.  Within 1.5-2 hours of finishing my meal full blown food poisoning symptoms began.  As of the next day I&#39;m still home sick.  Will not return, ever.<br><br>(I ordered tuna tartare, spicy Caesar, and a slice of classic cheesecake with strawberries)

First time eating at this particular Cheesecake Factory. I would say it&#39;s consistent with my expectations for Cheesecake Factory restaurants in general. The server was very nice and responsive. The food was also good. We had a couple of apps: chicken tacquitos and the buffalo chicken nuggets. Both were good but if I had to pick I&#39;d go with the tacquitos. <br><br>For my main course I had the Thai chicken with mango. As always with CKF the portion was big and I am now busting at the seams. I thought the chicken and the sauce were good. <br><br>Surprisingly enough I did not have any Cheesecake! But I have had it before and they are all delicious.

Date night. Normally we love cheesecake factory but everything that could go wrong with this trip did. <br><br>It starts with not being brought water for the longest, then we didn&#39;t get our order taken for a very long time. <br><br>We started our order with the Buffalo Blast appetizer, which NEVER came. The drink my partner ordered took about 20 minutes to show up. <br><br>Our main dishes were the truffle honey chicken which had good flavor but was 90% breading and the bang bang chicken and shrimp for which my partner asked for extra sauce and received only when his dish was half gone, and then it was the wrong sauce. <br><br>Our waiter (Daveanghn) made little attempt to explain or correct any of the wait times or errors. While they were busy, he only had 4 or 5 tables in our section, so we were baffled by the lack of service. <br><br>This coupled with a few questionable lunch experiences (my office is right near the walnut st location) probably means we won&#39;t be returning to this location.<br><br>We were too dissappinted to even stick around for cheesecake this time around! :(

Been here twice. Make sure you get here on an empty stomach if you plan on eating a slice of cheesecake on your own. Second time me and a friend decided to share a slice. No problem, they split it in half on two plates. Both times I have experienced really god customer service. The waiters are awesome. Only downside is that some of the seating area are kind of busy and feels like a school cafeteria.. But love their cheesecakes!

We walked into this restaurant super excited for Cheesecake Factory. The downstairs receptionist station was unmanned and no sign to say proceed upstairs. After waiting for several minutes we decided to go upstairs to see if that&#39;s where we needed to go after a group of 8 passed us proceeding upstairs. We were seated in an area with a nice view. The waiter didn&#39;t come to our table for about 20 minutes. By that time we were annoyed. He asked us if we were ready to order and when we said yes, he walked away. He walked by our table 3 times before we finally got his attention to place our order. The food came out faster than it took our waiter to first make an appearance at our table. (Another waitress brought it out to us.) I ordered the Miso Salmon. It was beautifully plated. The salmon was really good on the edges but a bit dry in the middle. My rice was over cooked. My mom ordered a salad which she really enjoyed. We both got cheesecakes to go. I&#39;ve never had this bad of service at a restaurant before.

As someone who has been to Cheesecake Factories around the country, this by far is the worst location I have ever visited. Everything was fine until I found two to three long hairs in my pasta. Our waitress wasn&#39;t attentive and after sitting there for a while we ended up flagging down another waitress. I was asked if I wanted a new dish, but the pasta itself was so bland it wasn&#39;t worth the wait. I ordered chicken carbonara, which is supposed to contain a creamy sauce. There was barely any sauce on the pasta and the chicken was very bland. The food was also extremely salty. My dads dish was so salty it was almost inedible. After my pasta was taken away our waitress avoided the table completely. Mind you when she apologized about the hair I told her it was okay and in no way showed signs of frustration. I do have to say I&#39;m surprised no manager was sent over, but they did take the dish off the bill. We did have to give our bill to another waitress after sitting there for awhile with the check. Our waitress did not return. Overall, bad food and bad service.

As much as I hated to lower the rating, last night was the last time I am going to this location.  We got there around 5:45, and it wasn&#39;t terribly busy.  We got seated, and 10 minutes later, no one came by.  Then a table was seated to our left and one to our right.  They got their drinks, and we never were even greeted yet.  A server came by, asked if anyone helped us yet, and said that it wasn&#39;t her table but she would take our order.  I asked for the Renee&#39;s half sandwich and soup because the soup sounded really good, and even thought it was hot out, I wanted to try it.  Ten minutes later, the server came back and said that the Renee&#39;s special was only for lunch.  I looked at the menu again, and while it said served until 5:00, the special was also on their regular menu of sandwiches.  I showed it to our server, who said &#34;The computer wouldn&#39;t let me enter it, I&#39;ll try again.&#34;  We finally got our waters, and I assumed all was fine.  FIFTEEN minutes later, the server comes by to tell me that the soup is completely different.  I looked at my husband and said, lets just get the check.  The server said ok, and walked away without trying to fix the situation.  After watching her give the checks to 3 other tables, my husband and I got up to leave, but stopped to speak to the manager.  <br>45 minutes sitting there and walked out because no one seemed to know what food they served (twice) and how to get us drinks and our check.  NEVER AGAIN.

I DESPISE chain restaurants. It&#39;s definitely not my first choice but on a pouring rainy day semi tired from work we settled on something quick and easy...so we thought. <br>Shrimp Alfredo- shrimp was dry and chewy, Alfredo pasta was season less, it&#39;s really hard to mess up a dish that&#39;s typically good if you just dump sauce on it but Cheesecake Factory center city found a way to make it bland and not very enjoyable.<br>Filet mignon and cheese balls-wanted to swap out one of the sides that came w/ the steak for the cheese balls and simply add the extra cost <br>(if necessary) since cheese balls are $10 and the sides are $5. They made such a huge deal about it. I even suggested they comp the cheese balls just to accommodate us as paying customers and that was empathically denied. Our waiter Christian was kinda cool but had NO power or willingness. The manager Manny was incompetent and rigid. I even said to him, &#34;Manny you aren&#39;t very good at your job are you?&#34; Lol <br>They didn&#39;t bring a steak knife for my friend to eat the steak with. They ran out of Riesling and the their Mojito was gross, had to send it back and just got Gingerale which was $3.00 and NO refills. <br><br>The entire experience was blah and reminded me why I&#39;m so picky about the places I choose to dine. Never again will I allow anyone to make me feel guilty for being a dining snob. I&#39;ll simply remind them of this experience and hopefully they get it...if not...ill be far away at Devon or Parc and I won&#39;t hear their judging.

Take the escalators up to the lively and spacious Cheesecake Factory located in the heart of Center City Philadelphia.  This place is known for their inviting ambiance, and more importantly,  the extensive variety of delicious cheesecakes they provide.<br><br>Food: 3.5/5 - The cheesecakes are without a doubt their signature desserts.  Rich, sweet, and absolutely fulfilling, these pieces (running from 6-8 dollars a piece) will have you wondering what flavor you should get on your next visit.  Their main dishes are not as impressionable and tend to be over-seasoned.  Many of their dishes consist of pasta, sandwiches, and other familiar American favorites (roasted chicken, tacos, etc).  The cheesecake alone gets a 4.5/5 rating in my book; however, the other options do not measure up.<br><br>Service: 3/5 - The waiters and waitresses are friendly but tend to get lost during peak dining hours.  No matter what request you have, they are extremely happy and willing to fulfill your request.... it may just take some time to get your check or that extra straw you needed five minutes ago.<br><br>Ambiance: 3.5/5 - Like any other Cheesecake Factory, this location is spacious and has a high-ceiling providing a nice break from the usual Philadelphian restaurant scene.  The warm colored interior invites birthday parties to the casual diners.  <br><br>Value: 4/5 - For a restaurant chain, the prices tend to be on the higher end.  However, these prices are justified by their huge portions.  They are much greater than your typical restaurants (especially in for being in the city).  More often then not, you will be coming out quite full and taking home the leftovers.<br><br>OVERALL RATING: 3.5/5<br><br>Personal Recommendation: For the best Cheesecake Factory experience, I recommend coming here just for the cheesecakes.  Expecting or looking for more will probably leave you a bit unsatisfied.
Cheesecake Factory? Pfffffttttt .... More like Macaroni House! Am i rite??? Dont like it fight me

I tried calling for a to-go order and was placed on hold 8 different calling times and no one ever picks up. Finally told someone who answered I kept being put on hold to no answer, and her response was just &#34;please hold.&#34; TERRIBLE customer service.

First time at this location and I was impressed! The service was excellent (our server&#39;s name was Steven). He was very attentive. We had a party of 4, celebrating a birthday. I ordered jambalaya which was great and plentiful. The other ladies had sandwiches which they enjoyed. Crab balls and calamari for apps, sweet potato cheesecake to go. Will definitely return!

Our server was friendly. That&#39;s the best thing i can say about our experience tonight.  We waited an extremely long time to be served dinner salads and when the salads were finally delivered only 4 of the 5 were correct.  So the 5th one was sent back and our friend was told that waited (she didn&#39;t even have an appetite anymore) <br> hers to finally be served, after the rest of us were basically finished ours.  The table next to us arrived after we did, were served their hot dinners and were eating by the time we had called over the manager to complain on the missing salad. The kitchen was unable to create a simple timely salad There were just 5 of us dining tonight. Manager comped the completed5th salad. Nothing else was done by the manager to leave us satisfied with this dining experience.  Don&#39;t waste your TIME and $.

Gross. I&#39;m not a germaphobe but they need a new dish washer. My first glass of water was sticky and had food flake off and then I ordered some and it came with big red lipstick marks. The service was terrible and then annoying. We&#39;d ask for a menu or a side of dressing and it&#39;d take 20 min but while my friend were clearly in conversation catching up our server kept budding in awkwardly. The cheesecake was good but that&#39;s about it.

I love the complimentary warm bread served at the beginning.<br><br>The greek salad is good! I also liked the white chicken chili off the Skinnylicious menu.<br><br>Original and smores cheesecake are A+

Had a no calorie count kinda day today and I enjoyed it by having the delicious cheesecakes (while chocolate raspberry truffle being my fav of all). <br>Starters: Avocado egg rolls was yum specially the dip that comes with it just makes it perfect. I loved it. Nachos was alright. <br>Main course: bang bang chicken and shrimp. Was too sweet for me. I am not sure if it always supposed to take like that but I did not enjoy it at all due to the sweetness. <br>Dessert: Plain cheesecake and raspberry truffle. <br>Great place to go when you are a big group and everyone has a different cuisine in mind as this place serves almost everything right from eggs to desserts!! Low calorie and full of calorie!! <br>I took off 2 stars only because the service seemed slow even on a empty afternoon lunch hour. We were a big group (16) no doubt but I think we needed 2 people to take care than just 1. The server was really good no complains but taking care of so many people was too time consuming and there was a long break between the appetizers and main course. <br>The quantity of food is huge. Definitely value for money!!

Great restaurant, but bad experience at this location: <br><br>Overall, typically: great food, especially drinks and cheesecake, at relatively more expensive prices. Nice atmosphere. <br><br>Bad experience tonight: Went here for half off cheesecakes. Sat at a table by the bar around 8:30pm and ordered our three slices of cheesecake. After about ten minutes, the waiter came to us and told us they were backed up in the bakery so it would be longer. We waited a total of ~40minutes until our cheesecakes arrived, and this was after having our nice waiter check in on them twice. A quick bite for cheesecake turned into an hour and a half meal... Do not recommend coming in for half off cheesecakes, unless you are willing to really wait.

Good for crowds.....<br><br>It&#39;s nice to have a family chain restaurant in the middle of the city.  Nice design as expected.  Huge place with large dining area.<br><br>It was crowded on a busy Saturday afternoon.  Didn&#39;t seem under staffed but service was at a crawl.  Although our server was really nice.  They placed us in an extended room (probably the private dining space).  <br><br>Weird that there was no music and we can hear all the other tables around us.  Asked to turn on some music to drown out some of the awkward silence and that never happened.  Oh well.  I just figured a good manager would know how to set the ambience though the establishment.  Where we were seated was probably an after thought.<br><br>Food.....it was ok.  Probably over priced for the entree that we ordered (some pasta, burger and appetizers).<br><br>Overall I still love this Chain because I feel comfortable enough to bring my kids here and not worry too much about their fussiness.

I have written other reviews regarding the regular dining menu at TCF. this review is strictly about the happy hour menu offered between 4 and 6PM Monday thru Friday.<br>I have gone once by myself around Five PM and it was very busy but my experience was very good. had to wait a bit for drinks sometimes but considering thre rush the delay was understandable. This time i went with a friend and we showed up right after Four PM. Big difference in the room. Not nearly as busy or loud.<br>I&#39;ll just list the items that we ordered along with their happy hour price-Chicken Pot Stickers ($5.50), Crispy Crab Bites ($7.50,real crab meat), The Warm Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip ($5.50-had two orders in house and my friend ordered one to go, that&#39;s how great the dip is. Intoxicating and addictive!), Dynamite Tempura Shrimp ($6.95-not as spicy as I had been led to think they would be but good flavor nonetheless. If you order the house wine, be it white, red, or zinfandel, (I had my usual Merlot) the price is $5.50. Name brand wines will cost more (Like my friend&#39;s Moscato @ $9.50). You can get beer for $3-4 and drinks such as Long Island Iced teas, mojitos, and margaritas for $5.50! There are so many appetizers that we didn&#39;t get to try this time nut are looking forward to on our next trip. The price is right and the earlier you come the better the service will be. After five it can get busy so things will take longer. Wanted to also mention our server Craig M. who answered our questions and, if didn&#39;t know the answer, he would go and find out. He was friendly and patient, even bringing us fresh, warm bread when the first basket came out cold and hard. Thanks Craig! <br>So, if you are looking to try The Cheesecake Menu without paying the regular prices, try their happy hour. You will probably be tempted into going back to try the regular menu at some point in the future.

As someone who is part of the industry and has been to Cheesecake multiple times, my friends and I were especially disappointed. The food was fine, you always know what to expect. <br><br>The service: To our server James, I guess he was having an especially bad day (we know bc he complained to us and our surrounding tables multiple times how he&#39;s been here all day). His banter with other tables as well as ours was EXTREMELY uncomfortable and inappropriate!!! Things were said that should NEVER be said as a server or by anyone in the service industry. <br><br>We waited an absurd amount for literally every part of our meal. We didn&#39;t get water or greeted for a good 10 minutes, in an empty restaurant. After we paid the check (which when we corrected him he told us to just give him $** amount bc I guess he didn&#39;t feel like changing it in the computer) and tipped him we waited around for our to go cheesecakes patiently even after everything, he finally came up to our table and said &#34;you can stay as long as you like I&#39;m just gonna get this out of your way&#34; and took my friends tipped check and the menus, but ignored the empty dishes in front of us. Then we told him we&#39;re sitting here waiting for our cheesecakes, which he so obviously forgot. Even after very clearly letting him know how to separate them for the 3 of us he brought it over in one bag... I am extremely forgiving of service where ever I go, and never leave this long of a review, unless it is this bad and a place where I expect a higher standard.

Been here twice, once for happy and once for lunch. My waitress was efficient and friendly. The food was soooooo good. My mother and I had the buffalo blasts as an appetizer. They are so good, highly recommended. Tastes like they were made from scratch. For the main course I had the chicken and shrimp gumbo while my mother had some type of chicken Alfredo. I ordered a passion fruit mojito, a little too fruity, it made my stomach hurt. Then finally for desert I had the snickers cheesecake. Omg it was so good. Everything was so good. Although it was crowded when we went, we didn&#39;t wait that long for food. Their menu is a little price so expect to spend at least $75-100.  Can&#39;t wait to go back

We came here for lunch today. The lettus wraps were served with wilted brown lettus, after we asked for fresh lettus we were brought a mix of fresh and wilted. The chicken it came with had skin on pieces which wasn&#39;t appealing. The chicken was also difficult to cut. The fresh vegetable salad was mostly lettus. We&#39;ve ordered both dishes at other franchises and had much better experiences. The waiter was nice but we are currently still waiting to overpay for our rather disappointing lunch.<br><br>We will not return to this location.

This evening I visited the Center City location of the Cheesecake Factory. My review is more about the amazingly kind service we received from the managers and the waitstaff after a very unpleasant incident. My two toddler sons and I were seated in a both behind a family that appeared to be recently seated as well. As I was placing our order with Priyanka our server, the woman behind us yelled that my 3 year old son had spit at her and on her. I immediately apologized and insisted he apologize, misunderstanding what the woman was insinuating. What she did not realize is that my son has struggled with speech in the course of his development and it appeared he drooled while chewing on his fingers on the marble surface between the booths as he was excited and trying to speak. The woman then berated my parenting and screamed at me in front of a crowded restaurant. Despite this unpleasantness, Brie and Brian the managers comforted and reassured me that no one saw my son spit on a stranger. They handled the situation beautifully and I am forever grateful.
Food is great  staff are kind also place is big and nice  so  i will visit again soooon

It&#39;s a shame, I love the food here. But this past weekend makes my 3rd trip to this location and the service is just fecal. Waited for an insane amount of time for a drink AT THE BAR while we waited for our table.<br><br>Our eventual server this time was actually terrific, I wish I remembered his name. But the rest of the experience was at best mediocre. And the food just took for fargling ever to come out. And it&#39;s never even busy enough to justify the slow service. <br><br>Also it&#39;s always super warm in there, maybe turn your AC on? It&#39;s Rittenhouse Square for Pete&#39;s sake, pick your game up a little.

Just walked out of there after standing in the entrance while the greeter with the long messy blonde hair was on the phone gossiping. My party and I were confused about whether we wait for her to finish or go up the giant broken escalator. So I kindly asked if we go up because we were unattended and she was clearly trying to avoid us. Then she held her hand up and said one minute please in an aggravated tone. So after going in circles for 30 minutes trying to find parking we dont even get acknowledged when we walk in to the place. I said screw it and we walked over to Pietro&#39;s Pizza and are now enjoying an amazing personalized pizza! To the woman with the dry ends please learn some people skills.

Justain, our waiter, was really nice. It was my birthday and my girlfriend was all like &#34;it&#39;s her birthday &#34; trying to get those annoying singers to come sing to me and bring all the attention to me. So I was like &#34;naw forreal don&#39;t do that. It ain&#39;t my birthday&#34;. And Justain gonna tell my girl &#34;I gotchu&#34; and give her a wink. So I was mad on the low cuz I really didn&#39;t want that. So when Justain comes back, I think he has all those ppl behind him but he came withour cake and lit a candle for me and whispered &#34;happy birthday &#34;. That made me happy. It&#39;s like my mans read me and knew I didn&#39;t want all those ppl in my face . So yeah great experience,I&#39;d highly recommend just based on that.Good lighting, nice intimate environment, great bathrooms and view outside the bathroom. I had a turtle cheesecake it was EVERYTHING along with the pina colada. Food was alright but the macaroni bites were different and I liked them

I was very disappointed with this particular restaurant because it&#39;s one my favorite restaurant chains. The manager (a female) was not attentive to us when 4 out 8 people at our table was served and 2 happened to be children. She heard our compliant and never returned to let us know what was going on or to even apologized or ask us how our food turned out. By the time the food came out, the other 4 people were almost finished and the kids had to eat bread because they were so hungry. I was never treated so poorly at any other cheesecake factory before in my life. When getting the check, the manager did take off the 2 kids entrees. but I had to let our waiter know that my dad and I didn&#39;t get our burgers until everyone else was done eating. How long does it take to cook a burger??????? Like really.<br><br>One positive thing, was the view. Hell, I&#39;ll take good service over view any day.<br><br>Valet was pretty pricey @ $22.00 a car. I would rather stick to Cherry hill, KOP, or Willow grove&#39;s cheesecake factory. I will NEVER visit this cheesecake factory location again.<br><br>My visit took place on 11-31-15
Is hair the new topping for your Calamari? Cheesecake Factory Philly this is disgusting

WORST BRUNCH EVER! If only zero stars were an option. My wife and I decided to give CCF a try for brunch today. As we came in the door there was no one greeting at the bottom of the escalator. So we ventured up to the restaurant and we were seated right away on the patio. The server was just straight preoccupied. As it took so long that we gave our drink order and food order at the same time. When he returned with our drinks my wife&#39;s tea cup was filthy. When the server returned he immediately said &#34;oh I forgot to tell you, we&#39;re out of French toast.&#34;  The restaurant serves so much bread how are they out of toast. Maybe they are out of eggs? We ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes as a replacement.  <br><br>While waiting for our food we noticed our server serving bread to other tables. So we asked can we have some bread.  &#34;Oh ya I forgot&#34;.  Our food came out before he returned with the bread. My dish was supposed to come with toasted bread. &#34;Oh sorry they burned it I will bring some out.&#34;<br><br>My crab Benedict was fine one of the eggs was over cooked. My wife&#39;s pancakes that we&#39;re supposed to be lemon ricotta were just plain pancakes.  When I complained to the server. He said the lemon ricotta was inside.   Well folks I cut a bite out of the center of each pancake and the lemon ricotta was lie, none found. I complained again. &#34;I&#39;ll let my manager know&#34;.  When he returned he told me his manager took our drinks off the bill.  I know this trick, he didn&#39;t talk to anyone he just hadn&#39;t added our drinks to the bill yet. Fine, I&#39;m not looking for a free meal. I just want it to be done and served correctly. So we asked for some syrup for our plain pancakes. We were told they don&#39;t have any except for the melted butter they served with the pancakes....  Thus my wife&#39;s pancakes were now non edible.  <br><br>Our server then told us that the Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t do brunch well at all and that we should have come for lunch or dinner instead. Way to talk about your own restaurant! Why even offering a brunch menu if you aren&#39;t going to offer it correctly?<br><br>Safe to say this will be my first and last visit to the tourist factory there are way to many good restaurants in Philly to waste your time in a non-customer oriented atmosphere.<br><br>I HATE writing bad reviews! But, I will when a service provider shows me they don&#39;t care!

Ok, this is weird! I had pretty good food and fantastic service at the bar. The food wasn&#39;t quite as good as King of Prussia but they&#39;re new so I was willing to write that off because they&#39;re still new.  So I got five star service and four star food,  so why a three star review? <br><br>I&#39;ve been going out to dinner for over three decades and have never experienced anything like this.  I also have a pretty good sense of humor and am generally hard to offend.  All that being said,  onto the story. <br><br>While eating at the bar a server came up and asked me,  who won the superbowl three years ago.  I told her I didn&#39;t know but I could Google it, she then began to berate me for not knowing and walked away. I just shrugged and went back to eating. <br><br>Three minutes later,  she asked and I quote &#34;Where would you most likely wake up with a finger in your ass&#34;. I had absolutely nothing,  wasn&#39;t even sure how to reply to that. Then I was treated to stories about how she came to work high everyday and what drugs she uses etc... AND SHE KEPT COMING BACK!!!!!<br><br>I don&#39;t know if she was high then or if she thought she was funny,  but I hurried up to finish my food and get out because it was just uncomfortable.  Worse part, they don&#39;t wear name tags so I can&#39;t tell you who she was. If the powers that be are reading this: she was the VERY obnoxious server working 8/25/15 @ 9pm. And if by any chance you&#39;re reading this maam, you&#39;re not funny but disrespectful to a patron who was just trying to enjoy a dinner

Ordered online and i only get a few mins for eating so im waiting extra time related to my order not being ready despite there is no one in here currently. Please dont order here online bc obviously it is not efficient and is pointless. im so annoyed especially since im pregnant and if i cant eat my lunch due to this slow service is a huge disappointment. I order at 10:30 for a 12:15 pickup and still here at 12:27p which leaves me less than 15 mins to eat so pissed

Avoid. This is unfortunately the poorest rendition of the cheesecake factory that I&#39;ve ever been to. Seeing as how they are the best restaurant in the world normally, I even tried this particular location twice, but each time was just as awful. As an avid cheesecake factory enthusiast, I have to give this location 0 stars, even the pre-made, frozen cheesecake could not be prepared properly by the staff. <br><br>The first time I ate here, my entree came with the wrong type of chicken, which I didnt&#39; care about but it was just mistake number 1 of what, ten? I lost count.<br><br>The waiters here disappear. You can even get up and go look for them but unless you know where the secret time warp portal is located you&#39;ll have zero luck entering their dimension to ask for something.<br><br>I disliked that I had to ask for a refill, ask for a napkin, ask for a straw, ask for a box, ask for an actual box, ask for a normal sized box rather than the 10&#39;&#39; by 10&#39;&#39; box for my leftover cheesecake, and then also have to ask for a bag. <br><br>I didn&#39;t like how the cheesecake was served warm and melting, without whipped creme, and without any acknowledgement. <br><br>I didn&#39;t like waiting for over 45 minutes for my food.<br><br>Will not be back, the KoP will have to do.

This is our second times in here this time me and my friend choose specialty fillet mignon, its a disappointment cause the more we eat it the more we feel the salt, they put too much salt on our steak. The beef is tender, it just too salty.

I&#39;ve been to another location before but this was my daughter&#39;s first visit to any location. I was in the area for educational training and she wanted the experience as I&#39;ve raved about the food (all of the food to include dessert) so she wanted to try. It was still light outside so it wasn&#39;t late but it was definitely dinner hours. It wasn&#39;t overly packed but a good amount of people coming and going. The flatbread we wanted - we were told there was no more so we had to find an alternative. She is a huge fan of margarita pizza. We did make another selection. The options we went with were good. However when it came to dessert we wanted strawberry cheesecake. We opted to get it to go as we were full from dinner but the take out cashier advised there was no more available. I would have thought to have an item that is so popular or in high demand there would be maybe a back up supply available. I don&#39;t work in the industry so I am not sure how that works but I felt the need to share the disappointment we experienced as there wasn&#39;t any other cheesecake option we really wanted but the strawberry. Original is good, don&#39;t get me wrong, but for her first time at the restaurant that everyone around her talks so highly about her experience was not as good as I was hoping it would be. I&#39;ve never been to a location where they were out of almost everything I asked for. Overall the staff was pleasant, just a bit disappointing she didn&#39;t have a good first experience.

There are MANY better dining options in Center City. This place looks great, I&#39;ll give it that. But the food was just OK and the cocktails are super pricey. <br><br>I don&#39;t typically go for the big chain restaurants, but I gamely went along today for a CF holiday work lunch for 12. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and was served way more bread than chicken. The fries on the side weren&#39;t very good. My friend ordered the soup and salad combo and they only had one soup on the menu, which was clam chowder. It was too peppery for her and the waitress offered to substitute fries for the soup, but there was no apology or flexibility on the substitution. (My friend declined the fries.) <br><br>When we got the check, I realized that my sangria was $11.50, almost the same as my entree. Whaaaat? It wasn&#39;t even very good. I checked out other Yelpers&#39; reviews and read that they don&#39;t put the cocktail prices on the menu. Not cool!

The Cheesecake Factory has always had solid food. I&#39;ve never been disappointed in the quality or taste of my food. But at all of the other locations, the delicious food came with efficient service, knowledgeable servers, and overall great experience. This has not been the case in the Center City location.<br><br>I have been there a few times, and always been disappointed and stressed by the length of the wait. Today&#39;s instance was particularly obnoxious. I went with a group of 15 for a work lunch. We did expect it to take more than an hour, but we certainly weren&#39;t expecting it to take almost two and a half hours.  Food orders weren&#39;t taken until we had been waiting for 30 minutes. We weren&#39;t all served for another 45. Then onto dessert, which didn&#39;t fully come out until about 30 minutes after they had cleared our entrees. <br><br>I would definitely recommend this place unless you have an absurd amount of time to spend here.

I have been a huge fan favorite of the Cheesecake Factory since they opened few ago in Philadelphia. But since their portions of their cheesecake have gotten very small about six months ago. My visits to the restaurant have shortened..

This place is the good, the bad, and the ugly. The good of course was the cheesecake, I had some kind of caramel pecan cheesecake that was 5 stars for sure. The food was bad, my salad was wilted and extra chewy, my shrimp was medium well and I believe that shrimp and seafood should be thoroughly cooked. The ugly was our waiter, I forgot his name but he was awful each course came to the table at least 20 minutes apart, I even had to look for him to get silverware to eat our salads with because there was none on the table when we sat down and he did not bringing any out with our food. We requested them and after 20 minutes of waiting I had to go and find him, geez.
Food n service was ok, great ambiance, l really like the red velvet cheese cake n crab cake but rest of the food r not really as we expect even they not season properly.

Service was very quick. I sat by the bar to watch the TV. The bartender Paul was great and pleasant. The bathrooms were clean! Seems like a very busy restaurant on a regular basis but it wasn&#39;t that busy on a Sunday. Trying to find parking is a nightmare unless you planned to be out and about all day and found a good spot or paid for the garage. Overall, food, cheesecake and drinks were great. Service was on Q and no waiting around. I am not sure how busy this place is on a Friday or Saturday but then again most places are mobbed on weekends regardless. Recommend it!

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory three times so far and have good good experiences each time.  Good food, nice sized portions, fairly friendly and attentive service.  Best of all, shockingly, both times I came for lunch it wasn&#39;t crowded at all.  At many Cheesecake Factory restaurants, it&#39;s packed to the gills no matter what day or time you go and often there is a long wait.  Not at this location - at least not the 3 times I went so far.  I guess there are many more options in the city to choose from.  Either that, or Cheesecake Factory appeals more to suburbanites than city folk.  At any rate, I&#39;ve been happy each time I have gone and the food and service are comparable to my hometown CF in Cherry Hill, NJ.<br><br>BTW, my favorite things to order are the fried mac &amp; cheese, the avocado egg rolls, the Bistro Shrimp pasta and for dessert, the strawberry shortcake, which is a biscuit-type shortcake with vanilla ice cream, strawberries and whipped cream.  Note:  it&#39;s HUGE and feeds 3 people easily.

Went for lunch. I got the chicken carbonara lunch size, which was delicious. The waitress was very prompt and nice. The hosts were also great. Only complaint is that I got a cheesecake to go. I waited for my uber and went home (about 25-30 minutes). I go to eat my cheesecake and it was still rock solid frozen. :(
Food is not as good as the one in New Jersey. Pork chop so hard to chew. And the angel hair is too soggy.

Went to Cheesecake Factory on Tuesday with my husband, brother, and friend. When you&#39;re going to the cheesecake factory you know what you&#39;re going to get - it&#39;s a chain restaurant with a menu that has pages and pages of options! We didn&#39;t have any sort of wait and were seated right away. This Cheesecake Factory looks like any normal Cheesecake Factory, however, what I did like was they have a seating area where the windows are open which is really nice.<br><br>We put in a drink order and an order of the Hot Spinage and Cheese Dip.  The drinks and appetizer came promptly. Our waitress was pretty knowledgeable..  apparently during the training they had to learn the whole menu and got to try most of the food for 2 whole weeks! For our entrees we went with the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon, and Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic. The Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic was the best dish out of them all and we&#39;ll definitely be going back for that dish!  The only complaint was that we wanted the Snickers Cheesecake, however, they were out of the ingredients so we ended up going with the Tiramisu Cheesecake and S&#39;mores Cheesecake - both equally yummy!

I rarely ever complain about a restaurants service and kitchen staff; however, the dining experience at this specific Cheesecake Factory was absolutely awful. For starters, the waiter listened to our orders, didn&#39;t write them down and then proceeded to come back to the table and ask us for our orders again. The three of us dining all made modifications to our orders. When he brought out orders over, he did not take note of the modifications, resulting in us having to wait even longer for our food. Once our &#34;correct&#34; food came over, there was still food missing and the quality was not good. My mom ordered the grilled chicken tostado salad. The tostado was limp and soaked instead of crispy, and there was no chicken on the salad. I ordered the Tuscan chicken subbed with salmon which comes with artichokes but there were no artichokes, and the salmon portion was so small. I had gone to the King of Prussia location the night before which had a salmon filet double the size served at the Philadelphia location. The manager was nice enough to give me another portion of salmon but the overall quality of service and food was sub-par at best. Will not be coming to this location again.

It is so lame but this was chain restaurant I really wanted to try haha. I just heard about this place a lot- huge portion, good dessert etc however I&#39;ve  never seen this place anywhere in city. Now I finally went! <br><br>Stopped by for lunch, got Alfredo fettuccini ( lunch portion) with chicken and classic burger with fries. We thought that would be safe choice since it was our first visit. Pasta was very thick, creamy like other chain restaurant. Chicken breast was moist and tender. My hubby enjoyed his burger and couldn&#39;t finish his fries. We were full so had original cheese cake piece to go. <br><br>Our server was very friendly and had full of smile on her face whenever we sees her. <br>Food was nothing ordinary but service was nice and I like to have this restaurant in the city.

Will not eat at this location again. Started with them telling us an hour wait. So we put in our name and came back 55mins later. At that point they said we were one of the next tables. Well 30 mins later we will were not called. We went up to complain and were told they were cleaning our table. 15 mins later we finally got seated. Total wait time was 1 HR 40 mins which is pretty ridiculous considering that when we got seated there were 4 large clean empty tables around us. <br><br>The server was prompt and polite. I had no problems with him. We put our order in immediately with our drink orders. We got our bread and it was not warm and was very hard on the outside. When the runners brought out our entrees they only brought 2 of the 5 out. 5 mins later (yes I actually monitored the time) the other 3 entrees came out. 2 of the entrees were wrong. My husband ordered spaghetti and received a sandwich and I ordered a burger and received a piece of meat on hard bread, nothing else was on the burger. I told the waiter and he apologized. I told the waiter to take back my incorrect food and that I did not want my food replaced so just take it off the bill which he did. They brought my husbands correct entree, but at that point everyone else at the table was already done. <br><br>By the end we were annoyed and just ordered the strawberry shortcake to share. The ice cream was good but the biscuit was very hard and inedible. <br><br>Definitely will not be returning!!
This place is always good. Service was great, food was great. If you stop by here ask for a window seat and you can enjoy some city views.

Great Location it&#39;s spacious, and offers a nice view of Center City Philly, depending on where you are seated. The atmosphere is pretty nice as well, and so is the staff. Also the menu is pretty solid, I love their salmon, brown rice, and broccoli, and Cheesecake for desert is very rich and tasty. I normally go for happy hour because I never experience a long wait during those hours.

This was my 1st time at this location.  The building and atmosphere is gorgeous.  Thankfully they have an elevator in addition to the escalators and steps.  I was with a rather large group of people, and we were able to be seated in a private room with a wonderful view of Philadelphia.  This was good and bad.  Why?  As it got darker outside, the dimmer the lights became on the inside, to the point where we were all pulling out our cellphones to use the lights to read our menus! <br><br>For my drink, I ordered a glass of Moscato.  Unfortunately they were out of it. :(  So, I ordered a glass of Riesling.  It was pretty good.  The only thing i didn&#39;t like was the fact that the wine glasses were so large, yet they only filled it up halfway!  I guess that&#39;s to make you order another glass.  Who knows.  Needless to say, for $9.50, that was my only glass of wine for the night.  Grade: B<br><br>My appetizer was the Fried Zucchini.  I asked for mine without cheese and marinara sauce instead of ranch dressing.  I was looking forward to it, since this is one of my favorite appetizers in the world, and everywhere I have gone either took it off of their menus or it has been absolutely horrendous!  Well...The Cheesecake factory made me happy!  Thick pieces of Zucchini sticks, light and crispy breading and wasn&#39;t served as a greasy mess!  The people I shared them with agreed that they were very good.  The portion was very large.  I ended up ordering more to go with my main course.  Grade: A+<br><br>My main course for dinner was Fish and Chips.  Well.  I can honestly say that I&#39;ve had better in less-costing restaurants.  The flsh was fried nice and crispy, but it was very bland.  The fries were good.  Grade: C<br><br>Dessert:  I ordered the Oreo Cookie Cheesecake for myself and the Godiva Cheesecake for my friend.  Both were awesome, like always!  Grade: A+<br><br>The only thing that I can completely say that I was truly upset about was the salad that I ordered to-go.  It was the French Country Salad with mixed greens, grilled asparagus, fresh beets, goat cheese, candied pecans and vinaigrette.  I was very disappointed when I got home and opened up the salad.  Extremely wilted lettuce.  There were only a couple pieces of beets and they looked dried out.  We won&#39;t even talk about the asparagus.  About 2 goat cheese crumbles.  All I can say is that this was a major disappointment for the amount that it cost. Grade:D<br><br>Overall, my experience with the food was ok.  Our server, Anna, did a good job with serving a large group.  The only issue I had was sending my check back for corrections.  <br><br>Will I go back to this particular location?  Not sure.  We shall see.   <br><br>Overall Grade:  C

My third or fourth time here. Haven&#39;t loved a meal yet. The food is just ok to me. I&#39;m always let down. The lighting is kept so low that it&#39;s difficult to read the menus. The A/C is always too cold for my liking. No more cheesecake factory for me.

Visited this location for the first time during my lunch hour and I was surprised that it was not crowded!  Food was delicious and the service was fast. I purchased a slice of cheesecake to go. Considering the small size of the slice, I think that the cheesecake is overpriced, but it is so darn yummy that I did mind spending almost $9 on the 1590 calorie desert :)

This was a typical Cheesecake Factory of which I am a big fan of. My wife and I looked up this one because we were starving and it was the closest and about the last restaurant open around midnight( they closed at 1230). We called ahead to see if it would be an issue with us coming at midnight and the person whom we spoke to said that it was no problem. Once we got seated our server immediately started rushing us to order our food. He also told us that he had been there all day and they were so busy that they didn&#39;t have anymore bread( that was ok). Throughout the entire experience we were rushed and the server was trying to get us out of there so quickly he forget a few things that we asked for. As I mentioned in the beginning of this review, I am a fan of TCF( The Cheesecake Factory) but don&#39;t go to this one 30 mins before they close even if they say it&#39;s ok when you call lol.

first time visiting Philly for business. Decided to check it out this place with my colleagues. Great atmosphere, nice decorations but quite dimmed light inside. <br><br>Now, we had an awful awful server that night. She was extremely rude, first I thought she was joking cause I thought it cant be this bad. I think she must be mad at management or something. I didn&#39;t have one of these servers for long time. My food didn&#39;t show up for maybe 20 minutes after everyone elses arrived. I had to wait to get our servers attention to let her know about the situation cause she didn&#39;t even come back to check on my colleagues food after she dropped it. She didn&#39;t even apologise, she didn&#39;t even offer discount. I guess this must be lack of management supervision. cause she was not caring anything all night long. It must be hard not to notice that by floor manager. Anyways, such a terrific experience.

It&#39;s gorgeous. A+ on the renovations of the building. Which also lends to big pluses on atmosphere. They are accommodating of all group sizes also another positive. They food there I have had has been solid and they are pretty accommodating with patrons amending their order. The service is average not terrible but nothing to note. My only hiccup is that everything on their menu gigantic and very high calorie. Even the &#34;skinilicious&#34; menu I question. Tough place for someone trying to eat healthy and not for anyone not looking for lots of food. That&#39;s just a personal preference though take from it what you will.
terrible food....ordered a med burger came well done and one hour later from eating it got sick...my son and wife hated there food as well .<br>...
This Cheesecake Factory is not my favorite one. The food was so so. The service was slow. I guess it is in center city. But will like to go other ones.

Went here two days in a row and each time entire experience was tremendous. Food was great. Service spot <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fon.menu&amp;s=84bc4b2659e0e1a6586716b0572a3372d2acbb629d26c3ef64b8b395d382ce9a" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">on.menu</a> huge &amp; very busy with the other patrons food all looking  great and all seemingly enjoying themselves. servings are huge ..I&#39;m not a big fan of cheese cake and never order it.however since I was there I felt obligated to try..it was delectable &amp; a huge piece enough to share ..<br>An army of staff all with a outstanding attitude and friendly professionalism thats unfortunately not all that common anymore .<br>Big fan and i would highly recommend !

Amazing cheesecake, just too bad they don&#39;t have smaller size since it comes in a huge size and it gets hard to finish in the end. Good enough for a dinner tough. The personnel isn&#39;t very kind I must admit

The Cheesecake Factory had great food when I went there with my father! But the service was not that great. Our server made some snarky comments and was in a rush to have us order. Continuing, the service was very slow. Our food took about 30 minutes to come out! That is too long. Also, the cleanliness was a problem. Our menus were sticky and gross.

First of all, brunch starts at 10.. we arrived at 10 and the doors were still locked. Finally the manager came down to unlock them and also sat us at a table since the hostess was MIA. As we walked through the restaurant to our seats I noticed that every single chair was THITHY. Covered in crumbs and food smears. I cleaned my chair with a napkin before sitting because it was so dirty. Our water had chunks of food or something in it. Dirty tables, dirty walls, dirty seats. Food was awful. Bread chewy like it had been frozen. Salt at the table was stuck together because it had gone bad.

Came here on opening day for lunch with friends and it was crowded within just 7 mins after opening. The place is definitely nice looking, fancy. The service was good and friendly. I ordered miso salmon. It took awhile to get here but it was good. Fish was cooked right. The miso sauce is a sweet creamy and soy base. It&#39;s not quite my thing sweet and savory. My friend said her food was a bit salty. Usually at the Cheesecake Factory is a hit or miss. Overall a good experience minus the manager guy not letting people upstairs because it is crowded or overwhelming.
Went there for lunch with my husband &amp; my newborn. I loved the food, ambience is pretty nice...we sat on the patio. Would definitely go back again!

When my coworker suggested we go here for lunch, I couldn&#39;t believe it was built already! We stopped in for lunch with only an hour to spare and I was a little worried we would make it back in time. However, I was pleasantly surprised! The staff was very friendly and our server made her present known but didn&#39;t hover. I ordered the Beets &amp; Goat Cheese and Edamame. Both dishes were good. My friend got the Turkey Burger, which she enjoyed. For a chain restaurant, this was a good experience. I would definitely return for lunch!

It was a bit crowded and the service at this location was slow and not very outgoing. Our server was unfriendly, slow, and took forever just to get our order right and delivered. The food was ok but I like that they had so many choices to choose from. And the cheesecakes are amazing! The best!

I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory since I was a young girl and this is the first time I can remember having a bad experience. My husband and I went for our anniversary dinner. We both had drinks, fish, and dessert. The service was excellent, as usual, but my tuna was so dry I couldn&#39;t eat it. His steak, which had been ordered medium rare, actually came out well done. How does that even happen??! We skipped our dinner and went straight to dessert. Definitely going to give this place a wide berth for the foreseeable future. Complete waste of $140! 2 stars for the service and cheesecake.
Omg !!! The best place for a nice dinner in Philadelphia, as always Cheesecake factory!!

The food was okay nothing to hype about. The service was slow I waited about 45mins until my food arrived. The staff there are very friendly &amp; opening....The best part was dessert which they are known for Cheesecake.
I love this place! I came here with a few co workers for lunch and knew that I was leaving with a slice of cheesecake. Absolutely sinful!!

My first visit to a CF, had a great experience. Had steak with mashed potatoes with Asian influences. Was amazing. Had a piece of salted caramel cheesecake for desert, we were three people sharing it but could not finish it. Very full tummy!<br><br>Nice staff but tables were a bit .. Unprivate. Close to the next table.
The food was the best! <br>Fort time trying their food because it was always so far. I&#39;m glad they opened one in the city and it would be great for them to be in restaurant week in the future ! !

My boyfriend and I went here and he left his phone. He called and they said they had it. He has two phones so he wasn&#39;t in a rush to go back and get it since he&#39;s so busy it was impossible to go all the way back when living far. Anyways when he went back yesterday they no longer had his phone. The manager brought out a couple of phones that was not his and said there was nothing they could do about it. I guess the phone had legs and walked out the restaurant. How about you have a safe place to your customer belongings if left  horrible customer service and I will never come back to a restaurant that steals.

We came very early in order to beat the crowd and wait. Happy hour had just started and we pretty much had the place to ourselves. We sat in the bar area and ordered fried mac n cheese and the avocado spring rolls. Both were absolutely amazing. We got the spring rolls with honey mustard instead. The service was fast. The only thing was the tomato sauce for the mac n cheese was slightly cold. They must have put that on the plate first while waiting for the mac n cheese to cook.

Came in at a not busy time 4:45 on a Monday, not only did no one come over after ten minutes but after saying something to the hostess I was still left sitting. I got up and left only to find the escalator now broken going down. I wanted my friend who had never been to try and no I doubt he ever will.

This place is a nightmare. It took us 43 minutes to order our entrees. An hour later - still no food. R u trying to kill me? Once the food comes out our waitress is nowhere to be seen meanwhile I&#39;m choking down spicy hot pasta with 0 liquids. The entire process took about 2 hours and 40 minutes. I&#39;m very upset.

The service here was HORRIBLE I wouldn&#39;t recommend anybody to go there, our waiter named ceyanni was rude and messed up our check twice, she didn&#39;t check on our table &amp; also walked away from us while we were talking to her. Overall the food was dry and burnt and the display of the food was sloppy. Don&#39;t eat here.

I often frequent the Center City location on Walnut St. My girls and I usually hang out after a long week at work. Well wouln&#39;t you know it the time my I bring my children with me our experience is the worst. I CAN&#39;T stand an establishment that changes up week to week. Well DON&#39;T need to go on. Definitely, won&#39;t be coming back.

The Cheesecake Factory is a decent place because you can get pretty much anything you want. From orange chicken to salmon. I would say that there salmon is amazing and is great quality. My only downside of this place is the health factor, but they do have a skinny menu. As Drake says, it is a good place for families.
If you&#39;re looking for a calorie dump straight to the midsection, go here. I LOVE the food, and the dessert is obviously great.

This location sucks. So I ordered to go after walking half a mile from where I&#39;m staying so I wouldn&#39;t lose my parking spot. I ordered the shrimp and angel hair, one of my favorite dishes. So when I walk all the way back and get to my food, it had no marinara sauce, about a quarter of the tomatoes that it&#39;s supposed to have, and only 4 shrimp. WTF?! I paid 20 bucks for this dish and it pretty much was only plain noodles with olive oil. I don&#39;t feel like walking another mile there and back to return this bland  joke of a meal. If you like cheesecake factory, avoid this one. It&#39;s obvious the cook here doesn&#39;t know or give a crap about putting the correct amount of ingredients in their recipes.
Lived up to its reputation! Outstanding food....and the cheesecake. Thank goodness I don&#39;t live that close!

&#34;TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!&#34;<br><br>I went there twice once with my b.f and once with my sister. When I went to with my bf, it was around 5pm and there was almost no ppl but it took at least 20 mins to order the food. <br>And last weekend, I went there with my sister around 3pm. And we waited 20 mins to get sits and it took 10 mins to order. And the server told us to bring the bread and she didn&#39;t bring us anything and I asked her again for bread and she ignored us and she was just chatting with her co-workers.<br>So eventually, we didn&#39;t get anything to eat for 50 mins once we got there. When I left there without eating anything, she did say one thing &#34;Sorry&#34;. I will never go back to that place again. It  really messed up my day.

This was the worst CF experience ever. Everywhere I go, I order the same item. Ordered it here and the chicken was dry and overcooked. They offered to remake it which was a mistake, as it took an eternity. Second round showed up better but still not up to CF standard. The waitress and manager were very gracious, but neither went out of their way to make it right. Bottom line is I walked out paying $28 (including full tip) for a mediocre meal that took forever. Not even an offer to comp my iced tea. Seriously? #1 rule of restaurant management: if at all possible, MAKE IT RIGHT!

After our third visit here, we will not be returning. Promptly seated, we waited 13 minutes for any server to take our drink order. A party (seated after) next to us had their drinks before we met our server. After waiting another 15 minutes 2 of 3 of our drinks arrived. Because &#34;the bar was running behind&#34;.  Our server also insisted there were no more kids cups. The same table across from us had one though. I ordered the Bang Bang Chicken wich had no Bang at all. Not a hint of spice. Wife ordered the Jamaican chicken which was just as lack luster. My daughter had spaghetti and marinara and surprise.. She likes it from our neighborhood diner more. I would only recomend cheesecake to go, if that.

The food is very good and consistent. Friendly table service. Portions are large even at Happy hour  - a great deal. Nice pours. However I&#39;m rating the service at the bar horrible. I&#39;ve been numerous times and I swear the bar tenders are trained NOT to acknowledge customers, Not to ask if they would like water or drink refills. Bummed out because I like the CCF.

The service here is great! I only discovered this place was a full out restaurant a couple years ago lol and I was pleasantly surprised at how upscale it was, while also keeping it casual. I love the complementary warm bread and butter, can&#39;t go wrong with that. The portions are very large and I believe well worth the hefty prices of some. I would say most of the entrees are shareable for two light eaters. I love the chicken Madeira. The cheesecakes are unsurprisingly delicious as well. Overall, with my numerous visits here, this Cheesecake Factory delivers with quality food and quality service.

Not a happy camper right now. I called in over a half hour ago to make a reservation and was told that a reservation was not needed for our party of 8... That a table would be available. Guess who&#39;s still waiting? They&#39;re only getting two stars because the food was good during my last visit.
Not sure this place needs a review. Amazing selection, huge portions, great service. I can&#39;t think of any negative thing to say.

My hubby and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner on Saturday night prior to a show, which was a short walk away, at the Merriam Theater.  We arrived around 5:45pm and were seated about 20 minutes later, which was the anticipated wait time according to the front desk.  Our waiter, Logan, was very personable and attentive.  The caesar salad was very fresh and tasty.  My husband really enjoyed his Jamaican Black Pepper Chicken and Shrimp.  The original cheesecake with glazed strawberries and whipped cream was delicious!

The Cheesecake Factory. If you been to one then you literally been to them all.  I mean you&#39;re here for cheesecake right? Oh, you actually like the food. The food is ok. Although, I had the Jamaican dish and the was worth wild to mention. So, the next time you&#39;re there order the dish and tell your server Wise recommended that meal. Btw, I left without getting cheesecake.

The servers work very hard here and are extremely friendly. I came one day with family and I really wanted to order the Filet Mignon steak they were sold out instead I ordered the pasta dish and it was amazing!
Worst place long wait for a meal, then came uncooked wet chicken. Turned it back waited an other 30 min for the check. Disappointed ! And it was at 3:30 pm not even rush hour yet

This place is awesome! If you just want a casual but sort of classy night out or lunch eat here! I went here for happy hour last week which was my first time! I love their happy hour i never even knew it existed until my friend told me! The cocktails are 5$ and beers are 4$ and their starters and small plates are 5$ and original sized. It was totally worth it! My friend and I had 3 drinks each and 2 small plates, paid 20$ for a great time! Their drinks are strong and the waiter was amazing. I hate how this place doesnt have proper reservation timings and its more of a wait. It gets a bit chaotic but totally worth it!

I called to make a reservation tonight  was told &#34; we do not take reservations for 2 people&#34; I replied a bit confused and the girl on the phone hung up on me. She didn&#39;t try to accommodate  me or ensure that we would be able to get a table if we just walked in. As a manager of a restaurant I would be furious if I heard my employee interact with a potential customer this way. Needless to say I will not be going there tonight. Management: if you&#39;re not going to take reservations for 2 at least teach your employees to be a little more welcoming.
Some of the worst food I&#39;ve ever tasted. The waitstaff is great but their poor excuse for maple syrup is awful and runny and the breakfast food is just sad.

I am not the kind of person that is against chain restaurants and will gladly eat at a cheesecake factory even when there are other non-chain restaurants to choose from. So I&#39;ve been to probably 4 other cheesecake factories in different cities and this one was definitely the worst. The shrimp in my pasta was very overcooked and the dish itself was underseasoned. I ended up taking home about 2/3rds and hooking it up myself for lunch/dinner the next day. The cheesecake was good as always though. But I am not in any hurry to come back to this location.

This review is only for Happy Hour. Monday - Friday 4p-6p. 5.50 for all drinks, a BROAD selection of appetizers, and the Happy Hour burger. This is seriously one of the BEST happy hours in Center City. The drinks actually taste like alcohol and almost everything is served in a regular glass (the kind you&#39;d get for a regular soft drink). The bartenders are also very nice and friendly overall. I can&#39;t speak to anything other than happy hour and the delicious cheesecakes which I love. I personally think 7.95 for a cheesecake is great.

The food was good, but the service was extremely bad! I asked for ONE minute to decide and the waitress comes back TEN minutes later. Not to mention she glanced my way a few times and noticed that I was ready to order. Extremely disappointed that the service sucked since the food was good. Not saying I haven&#39;t had good experiences before but this is was pretty bad. The table was not thoroughly cleaned and the wait time for a seat (when the restaurant was nearly empty) was way too long.

I have always enjoyed Cheesecake Factory for their large serving sizes and delicious food. Tonight I was underwhelmed. My portion of pasta carbonara was very small and the pasta was underdone and chewy. The smoked bacon was burnt and almost in recognizable. The service was extremely slow. Overall I am extremely disappointed.

First star is for the decoration. This location is for young people who cannot drive to other locations. Second star is for the service. Nice and friendly. Third star is for cheese cake. Should try the mango key lime one. Beautiful cake comes with multiple layer of flavors, tastes, and textures.<br><br>Minus 2 stars because the grilled food was horrible. I ordered KOBE Style burger with Medium cook. They handed me a burned well done and dried meat. I called the server to request a new one. My friends already finished their meals and I had to wait for my burger in 20 mins. Second time was less burn but still complete well done and dried. They use gas grill and you can smell the gas on every bite. I wanted throw up after a first bite. The sever was so nice so I just let it go and pack it home. Of course, I will throw it away. Cannot eat it. My friend&#39;s pork chop dish was $23 and it was burned as well. The burn layer was like 1/8 inches. She had to cut it out and eat it without requesting to change her dish.<br><br>In general, it was overpriced for the quality of food. It looks nice but not recommended for a date because people bring their kids and it may get lousy sometime.

I have no idea why this place doesn&#39;t have high ratings because i&#39;ve been almost all of the cheesecake factory in USA and this is one of the best. To be hones after Las Vegas, this is the best. Foods are good especially fried calamari is amazing, i know it&#39;s appetizer but it&#39;s really tasty. For main course fillet mignon is my favorite. I&#39;ve been writing as everything is perfect but i put 4 stars because of service. They should improve their service that&#39;s the reason why i choose the 4 stars instead of 5... But definitely i&#39;ll be back...

One star and only for the interior appearance. I got the garlic shrimp pasta with a basil lemon sauce and it was bland and doused in a ridiculous amount of oil. What a wasted $18. About $14 for a Ketel One martini, didn&#39;t realize I should expect Franklin Mortgage prices for a simple vodka martini. I was so turned off by my food that I didn&#39;t even get cheesecake for dessert (in hindsight, I should have just gone with dessert and skipped dinner there altogether). <br><br>The service was terrible, the hostesses were unfriendly and downright incompetent. Our server wasn&#39;t rude but definitely not very friendly and took forever to get us our round of drinks when it was mostly empty in the rest of the restaurant. Some of our table resorted to going up to the bar for their drinks, it was just so ridiculous. The general attitude is come in, spend a ridiculous amount of money for subpar food and it&#39;s ok because it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. It shows a serious lack of management and the struggling waitstaff is indicative of poor training. I actually felt bad for our server that she was struggling with simple orders. I mean honestly how hard is it to make sure everyone has water refills? AVOID.
Horrible, horrible, horrible place. The food is amazing, but the service is incredibly poor. I always sit at the bar and I constantly get bad service. They inattentive and they have bad attitudes.

I came here with a group of seven and we chose it to accommodate the large party and for a wide menu.  Both of those aspects were great, otherwise it was a disappointing experience. <br><br>We were seated instantly but then waited at least a half an hour for a sever to walk by.  Once they noticed us we finally got some water.  Three different servers came over and bickered to us about whose fault it was for the long wait.  There was then confusion as to who should take the order.  We asked for seven separate checks which one waitress said was okay and confused another.  Everyone apologized for the confusion but blamed each other and other factors instead of just apologizing.  Our waitress was somewhat curt and not particularly friendly.  <br><br>Once we finally ordered, it took an unreasonable amount of time for our food to come (it was not crowded that night!).  The food was decent, about what was to be expected.  However, our waitress never asked if we wanted more drinks or really paid us much attention.  <br><br>Once the meal was done, she brought us checks without asking if we wanted dessert!  Some of us wanted cheesecake (It is the Cheesecake Factory after all!) but since the whole process was so painful no one ordered anything.  She messed up three checks which took forever to sort out.  <br><br>The food was fine but the service was extremely lacking.  All seven of us are extremely patient and understanding, yet everyone said they wouldn&#39;t be going back.

The worst service ever! Got there at 4:20, the booth we were put into was too small for the baby seat, and when we asked hostess about it she just walked away. Then we took it upon ourselves to move. Then after we ordered they brought it the wrong order to 2 out of the 3 of us. So while one is us was eating for 20 minutes the rest were just waiting for their correct order. The. Our waitress couldn&#39;t remember anything we were asking for and had to repeat everything to her. Then she left in the middle of purser vice and we got a second server. This server was nice and then we asked if we could split the bill. She was accommodating until she gave us the checks, we gave her out cards and then when we got the receipts the amount had changed on out of our checks from originally 35 to 42!! How the hell does that happen? Please explain how you randomly add 2 sodas to a check that was already correct before we gave you out cards. Then she wanted to know If that extra was ok or does she need to get her manager... Um yes get your manager.. Then she returned with 6$ in cash  without the manager... Mind you the overcharge was 7$ . At this point we were so frustrated we just took our tip back and left. <br><br>This was supposed to be a nice night out for me and my cousins but ended up being a night where our patience was tried. Will not be returning back here anytime soon: most likely will go to Max Brenner&#39;s around the corner... Very disappointed

Just had the plain cheesecake it was wonderful I can&#39;t wait to go back to enjoy some of the other great things they offer . The place is beautiful and the staff is GREAT !!! Can&#39;t wait to go back
overly phony wait staff, ridiculous menu....<br>good veggie burgers and a few other items , salads average...good coffee ...<br>been here to this location several times..

I went here tonight with friends based on one of their recommendations and my inkling to want to try it out. We ate a table near the bar and had very friendly waitstaff who were quite accommodating but a little bit slow, the restaurant/bar area wasn&#39;t very crowded.  We each had a beverage and a skinny-liscious appetizer.  It took awhile for the food to arrive, I had a trio of lettuce wrapped tacos which were messy but very good. One friend enjoyed his flatbread pizza which sounded and looked delish, my other friend enjoyed her app but part of it wasn&#39;t great, I tried it and wasn&#39;t impressed.  All in all it was a fun evening, the music and ambiance was nice. $49 for 3 apps, 1 drink, 1 soft drink seems a little steep to me.  We were all hoping for a light, skinny- licious desserts which they don&#39;t offer. I will probably still come again but I was hoping for more.

I have been to many Cheesecake Factories, and this one was subpar. All the food was extremely salty and the zucchini appetizers looked like 8 French fries on the plate. The service was slow and the portions were smaller than I have expected from CF. The chicken was dry, I don&#39;t know what they are doing at this place.

Came here with my coworker tonight and the food was badly prepared. There was 5 of us and 4 of us ordered the ribeye. We asked for one well done, one medium rare, and 2 medium. The well done one came out burnt my coworker kept saying it taste bitter because of the burnt charcoal on the steak. My husband medium and other coworker was both well done. My coworker didn&#39;t mind but we had to send my husband steak back. There is no way I&#39;m paying $30 for a steak not done the way I want it. My medium rare, came medium, no pink at all. It was late, around 12am, if it was any other time I would definitely send all four plates back to the kitchen. They need to hire new cooks or train their staff better on how to prepare steak. And my husband didn&#39;t even get his second steak because the manager came over and said it was the last piece of steak in the house. He didn&#39;t even seem apologetic or anything. And when we decide to change my husband entree to a pasta dish. When I asked the manager if he could not charge us for the steak and charge us for the pasta instead he seemed annoyed. As if we were in the wrong. I won&#39;t be returning to this location any time soon after tonight&#39;s experience, $200 on crappy food.

I really hate to give such a low rating to a restaurant I usually always enjoy going to but that&#39;s as generous as I can get from my dining experience here.<br>Before anything, I&#39;m a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory. I probably dine in my local location once every month or two so i thought i might give this new location a try.<br>There were four of us seated and were eager to order. The inside of this Cheesecake factory is truly beautiful and has a great ambiance.<br>Our server then brought out three waters when it was clear that there was one more person in our table. Everyone makes mistakes so we weren&#39;t so bothered by this. Time passed and we noticed that we didn&#39;t receive our breadsticks yet and our food was almost ready. We asked our server and all he could say was &#34;Oh, you want breadsticks?&#34;...<br>Our food came out and nothing to say about that, it was still as delicious as the other locations!<br>However, our server didn&#39;t bring out cheese or serving spoons and we, once more had to ask our server for this.<br>Come for the food but don&#39;t expect great service.

Yuck, Yuck and Yuck!!<br>This is not the normal cheesecake factory. Usually I really like Cheesecake factory, but not this one. <br>The hostess was great. That was all. <br>Sat at a high top bar table; the waiter seemed as if we were a bother being there and making him work. <br>The fettuccini alfredo was gross, the noodles were soggy, and clumped together. <br>When the busser was setting a table across from us, he touched the fork tines, the eating part of the spoon and the knives. Leaned over the clean plates to set the far settings.<br>Used a dirty napkin to wipe the table. <br>Don&#39;t waste your time...find a better place.

I usually Love going to Cheescake Factory and was very excited when they opened a branch in Center City. So I went to check them out Wednesday night and the venue didn&#39;t disappoint. They had a wall of windows that gave a good city view and the decor was typical for their restaurants. I decided to order a dish I&#39;ve had before at the KOP site - the lemon and garlic shrimp with asparagus and angel hair pasta (off the low cal menu). While the taste of the dish was fine, the sauce had a weird gelatinous quality that limited my enjoyment. The cheesecake was great as usual.

Went to lunch with a friend.  My friend ordered a burger and I ordered a &#34;Make your Own Omelet&#34; to go.  I ordered: Egg white, pepper, onions, ham, and mushroom with sweet potato fries and wheat toast.  I paid whatever price.  20 minutes later, end result, I received an egg yellow omelet with mushroom and peppers and wheat toast.  I noticed it was wrong but I had to get back to work.<br><br>They are batting less than .500 on my order.  Thanks Shannen N.

I am quite surprised by all of the negative reviews that I have read for this restaurant. I am not a stranger to fine dining and have been to several of the top restaurants not only in Philly but around the world so it is not like I have unsophisticated tastes or an unsophisticated palette and I can certainly recognize good service from poor service. I have only been to this restaurant once but what is not to like?  The venue is stunning and the location is superb.  The tables are set far apart from each other and the ceilings are very high making it easy to catch up with friends and loved ones in a seemingly private and quiet setting.  I found all of the wait staff to be very friendly and accommodating and there are tons of delicious and inexpensively priced items to choose from on the menu.  I appreciate that they offered a skinny menu and found the chopped salad on that menu to be amazing. At $12 I had it for dinner and for lunch the next day.  My friend and I started with the tuna carapacio which was wonderful and we also enjoyed our cocktails.  I don&#39;t think the overall three star review that this restaurant has is indicative of the experience that you will have there.

Great restaurant, just not this location. After being CCF-lovers for quite some time, the service at this location let us down. Randomly stumbling in on a Monday night, my friends and I were seated immediately. The nightmare began when our waiter first approached the table to greet us and asked us if we had any questions about the menu, after waiting and waiting, he brought out only three waters.. when there was clearly four of us. We proceeded to place our orders, and after patiently waiting for our food and breadsticks, nothing. We called over the waiter and asked &#34;hi may we have our breadsticks?&#34; he replies, &#34;oh, you want breadsticks? sure&#34;. We were very disappointed at the fact that we may have never received breadsticks if we had never asked.
